loans.name: Raquel Sebastiana

texts.es: Raquel tiene 39 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Pomalco en la parte rural de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace 3 años, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Realiza esta actividad en un terreno situado cerca de su domicilio. Cría los animales y una vez que ellos alcancen un buen tamaño y peso los vende en el mercado local. Cuentan con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para realizar arreglos en su corral. Raquel cuenta con muy buenas referencias laborales y personales. Es muy trabajadora y encargada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio para poder seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Raquel is 39 years old, widowed, and has 2 children.  She lives in her own home in Pomalco district, in the rural part of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For three years, Raquel has been raising and selling animals.  She carries out this business activity on a plot of land near her home.  She raises the animals until they reach a good size and weight, then she sells them in the local market.  She has an established customer base in the area.  Raquel learned this business from her father which means that she knows the work perfectly.  She has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to make some repairs to her pen.

Raquel has very good work and personal references.  She is very hard-working woman and committed to her family.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing her business so that she can get her family ahead in life.

loans.use: to make some repairs to her animal pen

loans.name: Roena

texts.en:
Roena M. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old and married, with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Roena operates a store where she sells products for daily use such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Roena has been engaged in her business for more than 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Roena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Roena is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase canned goods, rice, dried fish, bagoong (fish sauce), sugar and spices. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Roena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, rice, dried fish, bagoong (fish sauce), sugar and spices

loans.name: 11Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hồng Lê Thị (59) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Hồng is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 11-Đông Vệ (08.01.11-Đông Vệ).

Hồng is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hồng owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Hồng has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hồng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hồng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Loan (57) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Lê Thị Nga (58) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  N. Thị Hương (60) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  N. Thị Huyền (61) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hồng Lê Thị (59) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hồng là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 11-Đông Vệ (08.01.11-Đông Vệ ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Hồng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hồng kiếm được khoảng 2,500,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hồng đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hồng đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Loan (57) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Lê Thị Nga (58) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  N. Thị Hương (60) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. Thị Huyền (61) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 51 años de edad y es casada. Viven en Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 6 años, cuenta con una pequeña bodega situada en su domicilio donde vende víveres y artículos de primera necesidad. Se encuentra casi 30 minutos del pueblo de Olmos. Por la lejanía, el negocio de Santos es una de las pocas bodegas en su región. Por ende cuenta con una clientela establecida y fiel y logra una buena margen de ganancia. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería como arroz, azúcar, y aceite. Con la inversión de su crédito, podrá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida para ella y su esposo. 

Ha tenido otros préstamos y cumplió con sus obligaciones en una manera puntual. Se ha visto que ha crecido su negocio porque cuando comenzaba solo vendía gaseosas y golosinas. Ahora está comercializando arroz, azúcar, aceites, fideos, leches, etc. Santos se siente satisfecha por la confianza que los prestamistas de Kiva y Edpyme Alternativa han depositado en ella.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old and married.  She lives in Olmos, an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, more than one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For 6 years, Santos has had a small grocery store located in her home where she sells food products and essentials.  She is located almost 30 minutes from the village of Olmos.  Owing to this distance, Santos' business is one of the few grocery stores in her region.  Consequently, she has an established and loyal customer base and manages to make a good profit margin.  She would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise such as rice, sugar and oil.  By investing her loan, she will increase her income and improve her own and her husband's quality of life.

Santos has had previous loans which she has repaid punctually.  It is clear that her business has grown because when she started she only sold soda and candies.  Now she sells rice, sugar, oil, noodles, milk, etc.  Santos feels satisfied with the trust that Kiva lenders and Edpyme Alternativa have placed in her.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: 05-Đông Vệ Group

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio L. is from the city of Gala Ozamiz City. He is 37 years old. Rogelio is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rogelio  operates motor transport services. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for more than a year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Rogelio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Rogelio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián tiene 26 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en casa propia con su familia en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz en Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Su comunidad es rural, joven y en vías de desarrollo. 

Desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos y aceitunas. Cuenta con su puesto propio ubicado estratégicamente en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado grande, muy conocido y con bastante movimiento. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fiel. Compra sus productos de pequeños comerciantes que llegan de la sierra a expender sus productos. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar una congeladora y así mejorar la calidad de sus productos. Desde que se inició, su negocio ha crecido notoriamente, lo cual está reflejado en el incremento de sus inventarios. Sebastián es muy trabajador y responsable. Ha manejado otros préstamos y cumplió con sus obligaciones en manera puntual.
texts.en:
Sebastián is 26 years old and is single. He lives in his family’s house in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz in Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. His community is rural, young, and on the way to development.

Since he was 4 years old he has been selling cheeses and olives. He has his own strategically located place in the Moshoqueque Market, a large market that is well known and sees a lot of business. He has an established and loyal customer base. He buys his products from small-scale merchants who come from the mountains to sell their products. He has requested a loan of PEN 2,000.00 to buy a freezer so that he can improve the quality of his products. Since he started, his business has grown notably, which is reflected in his increased inventories. 

Sebastián is very hard-working and responsible. He has had other loans and lived up to his obligations in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for his products

loans.name: 06-Dong Ve Group

texts.en:
Lan L. T. (33) is a 62-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Lan is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 06-Dong Ve (08.01.06-Dong Ve).

Lan is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling food products in the local community. Lan has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from it.

In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which was used to invest in renovating the business. Lan is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 2nd loan Lan has taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  N. T. T. Dung (35) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

2.  T. T. Huong (36) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

3.  P. T. Binh (37) is a 52-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lan N. T. (33) là 62 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Lan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06-Dong Ve (08.01.06-Dong Ve).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thực phẩm trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Lan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lan kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Lan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.253.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.159.600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. T. Dung (35) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.159.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  T. T. Huong (36) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.159.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  P. T. Binh (37) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.159.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noe tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia con su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace seis años, se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral para lo cual cuenta con granjas apropiadas. Realiza esta actividad en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando los animales alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Complementariamente trabaja como peón en una parcela.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 400 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus aves. También desea realizar unas mejoras a los corrales para protegerlos durante esta época de lluvias.
texts.en:
Noe is 45 years old, single and has two children. He lives in his own home with his family in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area located in the region of Piura, more than four hours outside of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. 

For six years, he has been raising poultry, for which he has the suitable land. He carries out this activity in the area behind his house. When the animals reach a good level of development he offers them for sale to the traders that usually visit the area where he lives. He also works as a hired farm labourer.

He has requested a loan of 400 New Peruvian Soles with Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for his poultry. He also wants to carry out some improvements to the corrals to protect them during the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for his poultry and improve his corrals

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita L. is from the city of Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old. Florita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Florita raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Florita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Florita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Florita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the second loan taken out by Florita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Mil's Group

texts.en:
There are ten members making up this village bank loan. Mrs. Mil is the village bank president. She was selected as the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this group loan will use their money to support their different purpose. 
Mil was born in 1975.  She is a widow with two children: one is a farmer and the other attends a local school. Mil is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land which she uses to grow rice and corn for a living. She wants to grow corn in the dry season, but she doesn’t have enough money to grow it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for cultivating corn.

loans.use: to cultivate corn

loans.name: 04-Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Khâm Đỗ Thị (17) is a 62-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Khâm is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 04-Dong Ve (08.01.04-Dong Ve).

Khâm is married and has 2 adult -aged children. She owns and operates a business providing general clothing services to local community members. Khâm has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from it.

In 2010, Khâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Khâm has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which was used to invest in renovating the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 2nd loan Khâm has taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  N. Thị Hồng (18) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600  VND loan to support her clothing business.

2.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Wiude Yanet

texts.es:
Wiude tiene 30 años y es soltero. Vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de fruta como plátanos, granadillas, y guabos. Cuenta con un puesto en el mercado local. Es muy conocida en su región y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fiel. Para facilitar el transporte de sus sacos de fruta del campo al mercado, cuenta con un motocarro, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería como marayuca y mango. Por ello, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Wiude es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y cumplió con sus otras obligaciones en manera puntual. Es muy trabajadora y responsable y posee buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad rural.
texts.en:
Wiude is 30 years old and single. She lives in her parents' house in the district of Motupe, an agricultural area in Lambayeque province that is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells fruits, such as bananas, grenadines and guavas.  She has a stall at the local market.  She is well-known in the region and has an established and loyal clientele.   She wants to expand her business by buying more merchandise, such as passion fruit and mangoes, which is why she is seeking this loan with microfinance partner Edpyme Alternativa.  She is a repeat customer with Edpyme Alternativa and has always made her previous payments punctually.  She is hardworking and responsible and can count on the good word of her rural community.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as passion fruit and mangoes

loans.name: Jill

texts.en: Jill S. is from the village of Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City. She is 35 years old and is married with three school-aged children. To make a living Jill owns and operates a livestock business. The business's main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Jill has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011 Jill joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jill is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jill from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 66 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su familia en Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno y ovino. Cría los animales menores y cuando alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en los mercados locales. Alejandrina es muy conocida en el mercado y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fiel. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus animales. Con esta inversión, sus animales podrán lograr mejor tamaño y peso y Alejandrina podrá venderlos a mejores precios, incrementando sus ganancias. Posee buena referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad rural. Ha tenido otros préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa y cumplió con sus obligaciones en manera puntual.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 66 years old, married and is taking care of two children. She lives in her own home with her family in Olmos, an agricultural area with considerable commercial activity located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half outside the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells cattle and sheep. She takes care of the small animals and when they reach a good level of development she offers them for sale to the local markets. Alejandrina is very well known in the market and has an established and loyal clientele. She has requested a loan of 1500 New Peruvian Soles to invest in balanced feed for her animals. With the investment, her animals will be able to reach a greater size and weight and Alejandrina will be able to sell them at higher prices, increasing her profit. She has good personal and work references in her rural community. She has taken other loans with Edpyme Alternativa and completed her payments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her livestock

loans.name: Tean's Group

texts.en:
There are ten members making up this village bank loan. Mrs. Tean is the village bank president. She was selected as the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this group will use their money to support their different purpose. 
Tean was born in 1967. She is a widow with one child who attends a local school. Tean is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land which she uses to grow rice and corn for a living. She wants to grow rice and corn in the dry seaS., but she doesn’t have enough money to grow it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to support her farming.

loans.use: to support farming

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en: Feliza A. is from the village of Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old and is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living Feliza owns and operates an agricultural business, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Feliza has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010 Feliza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Feliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Feliza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and labor for farm maintenance. This loan will be the second taken out by Feliza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and labor for farm maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy display cabinets, mannequins, shoes and more clothing

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by farming and selling vegetables. Her husband Jose, who is 57 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are between 15 and 32 years old. Norma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Norma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,600, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 to buy fertilizers and to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Norma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en: Rose Ann L. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old and is married with two school-aged children. To make a living Rose Ann owns and operates a general store. The business sells a variety of different products in the local community. Rose Ann has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011 Rose Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rose Ann is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase dried fish and bagoong (a fish-based condiment) for sale. This loan will be the first taken out by Rose Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and bagoong for sale

loans.name: Elena Lourdes

texts.es:
Elena es madre de casa de 37 años de edad. Es casada con 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia, la cual ha ido construyendo de a pocos, en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de cortinas y de productos lácteos, los cuales trae de Cajamarca, una ciudad a más de seis horas de Chiclayo y muy conocida por sus productos lácteos, especialmente el queso. En Chiclayo, Elena vende por catálogo sus productos. Visita a sus vecinos y amistades quienes le hacen pedidos para sus productos. Desea ampliar su negocio y responder al aumento de demanda para su mercadería. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Elena es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y tiene un buen historial de pagos.
texts.en:
Elena is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She lives in her own home which she has gradually built over time, in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Elena's business is selling drapes and also dairy products which she buys in Cajamarca, a town which is located more than six hours from Chiclayo and which is very well known for its dairy products, especially its cheese.

In Chiclayo, Elena sells her products through a catalog.  She visits her neighbors and friends who make orders for her products.

Elena would like to expand her business and respond to the increase in demand for her merchandise.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Elena is a long-standing client of Edpyme Alternativa and she has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more drapes and dairy products

loans.name: Leab's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of six members. Mrs. Leab was born in 1976, and she is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this group will use their money to support their different purpose. 
She and her husband, Mr. Mey, are farmers who own a 2.50-hectare plot of land which they use to grow rice. This couple has three children: two attend the local school and the youngest one is 5 years old and not in school yet.  They want to cultivate rice in the dry season, but they do not have enough money to grow it. Thus, Leab would like to ask for a loan to support her farming.

loans.use: to support farming

loans.name: Jaclyn

texts.en:
Jaclyn L. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Jaclyn is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Jaclyn runs a general store. She has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Jaclyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jaclyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jaclyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Feliz es padre de familia de 40 años de edad. Es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando plantas de cacao, limón y banana, los cuales los cosecha quincenalmente. También se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, el cual cría de edades menores y cuando los animales hayan alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo, los vende en el mercado local. Cuenta con un pequeño terreno cerca de su domicilio donde realiza estas actividades. Ha solicitado un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos orgánicos y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Espera poder mejorar la calidad y cantidad de los frutos para aumentar su venta e ingresos.

Feliz es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Feliz is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children.  He lives in his own home in Tambogrande, an agricultural area located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Feliz has been farming for 10 years.  He grows cacao, lemon and banana plants which he harvests every two weeks.  He also raises sheep.  He takes them at a young age and when they have reached a good level of development he sells them in the local market.  Feliz has a small plot of land near his home where he carries out these activities.  He has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy organic manures and fertilizers for his crops.  He hopes to be able to improve the quality and quantity of his fruits so that he can increase his sales and income.

Feliz is a father who is committed to his family and he is always looking out for their well-being and development.  People who know him have a lot of respect and affection for him.

loans.use: to buy organic manures and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 47 years old. Josephine is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Josephine prepares "longganisa" (pork sausages) and "tocino" (cured pork)  for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia que está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuentan con los servicios básicos como luz o agua potable.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Cría sus animales en corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa. Tiene más de seis años de experiencia en esta actividad. Ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de su ganado y aves. Desea obtener un mejor peso y tamaño de sus animales para venderlos a un mejor precio y lograr mayores ingresos. Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora. Su esposo y ella trabajan juntos para seguir adelante y lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She lives in her own home which is located in Tambogrande district, an agricultural area which is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.  She lives in the rural part of this district and doesn't have access to basic services such as light or drinking water.

Rosa raises sheep and poultry.  She fattens them and then sells them in the local market.  She raises her animals in pens behind her home.  Rosa has more than six years experience in this business.  She has requested a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced animal feed for fattening her sheep and birds.  She would like her animals to obtain a better weight and size so that she can sell them for a better price and make more profits.  Rosa is a very hard-working woman.  She and her husband work together to get ahead in life and improve their family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: 02-Dong Ve Group

texts.en:
Nghi H. T. (7) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Nghi is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02-Dong Ve (08.01.02-DongVe).

Nghi is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business providing general clothing services to local community members. Nghi has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from it.

In 2010, Nghi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nghi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which was used to invest in renovating the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 2nd loan Nghi has taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  M. T. Thu (8) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her clothing business.

2.  L. T. Phuong (9) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her clothing business.

3.  L. T. Dao (10) is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her clothing business.

4.  N. T. Nhi (11) is a 38-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her clothing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nghi H. T. (7) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Nghi là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02-Dong Ve (08.01.02-DongVe).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nghi thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nghi kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Nghi đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nghi đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.253.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.159.600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  M. T. Thu (8) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.159.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


2.  L. T. phuong (9) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.159.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


3.  L. T. Dao (10) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.159.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


4.  N. T. Nhi (11) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.159.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina P. is from the town of District 1, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Merlina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. 

Merlina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: 03-Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Hương N. Thị (122) is a 33 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Huong is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 03-Đông Hải (16.02.03 Đông Hải).

Hương is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, she operates a family member's business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community. Hương has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately $144 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,248,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business. 

Hương is now requesting a new loan of 5,787,900 VND which will be used to purchase corn to make popcorn and resell. This will be her 3rd loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  C. Thị Hoa (78) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.

2.  N. Thị Kha (11) is a 69-year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  N. Thị Lâm (51) is a 44,year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

4.  Lê Thị Tươi (60) is a 35,year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

5.  N. Thị Huệ (115) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.

6.  N. Thị Hường (41) is a 46,year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Hương N. Thị (122) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Huong là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03-Đông Hải (16.02.03 Đông Hải).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hương thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hương kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hương đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hương đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4,248,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,787,900 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

Teresita C. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Teresita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals in their village. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $166 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. 

Teresita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en: Aurea is a 28-year-old married woman who supports her family by making nipa roofs and growing vegetables.  She lives in Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her nipa roof making and vegetable farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Aurea is borrowing PHP 12,000 to purchase raw materials for making nipa roofs.   This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Aurea aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina L. M. lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture. She has been living in the area of Shanti Nagar for the past 10 years in a two-room brick house with her family. She is married to L. M. who is involved in the animal food selling business. He supplies animal food to his customers and earns income for the family. They have four sons who are unable to attend school due to financial constraints. 

Samina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy animal food in bulk quantity to fulfill his customers' demand and earn extra profits. He has been in this business for the past five years and Samina is very confident that an investment will earn increased profits and she will be able to send her children to school. She is a regular loan user of Asasah; this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit by paying her installments on time and attending all recovery meetings.

loans.name: 3 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hoan N. Thị (14) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Hoan is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 3 Đông Vệ (08.01.3 Đông Vệ).


Hoan is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To make a living, Hoan owns & operates a clothing business.  The main source of income for the business comes from providing general clothing services to local community members.  Hoan has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Hoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hoan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase cloth to resell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hoan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. Thị Tỵ (12) is a 61 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


2.  H. Thị Giang (13) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


3.  N. Thị Tân (15) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


4.  N. Thị Lan (16) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoan N. Thị (14) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hoan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 3 Đông Vệ (08.01.3 Đông Vệ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoan kiếm được khoảng 2,500,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hoan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. Thị Tỵ (12) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


2.  H. Thị Giang (13) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


3.  N. Thị Tân (15) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


4.  N. Thị Lan (16) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

To make a living, Domingo owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish balls and other dim sums to the local community. Domingo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Domingo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Domingo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Domingo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Domingo's third loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad is a 40-year-old widow and a very active lady. She works in the fields and grows different seasonal crops. After cultivating the crops she sells to different shops and people to earn profits for her family. She has 3 sons. All of them left their education after the death of their father and started work to support the family financially. Two of them have a construction supply business, while the third one is a daily wage laborer. Irshaad resides in Khanewal, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in the area of Shanti Nagar for many years in a 2-room brick house.

Irshaad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her sons' business. With the loan, they will buy construction supplies such as sand, cement and bricks in larger quantities to fulfill the clients' orders and make more profits. They have been in this business for the past 5 years and Irshaad is hopeful that an investment will help them earn more by improving their business. Irshaad is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her thirrd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio A. is from the Barangay of Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 48 years old, married, and blessed with 2 adult children. To make a living, he is presently engaged in a baking business. He’s been engaged in this kind of business activity for 5 years. He’s earning an average amount of not less than 4,000 PHP a month from this kind of activity. 

In January 2011, Rogelio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio, as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Medal Pangnegosyo 2 Program, is now requesting 5,000 PHP as his first loan, which will be used for additional capital for his photocopying business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments and possible business expansions.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen R. M. is 38 years old and married to R. M., who has been a farmer for the past 10 years. They have three children, all of whom attend school.  They live  a small city called Khanewal, which is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and is known for agriculture. She has been living there with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 18 years. Her husband grows different seasonal crops on his small piece of land. He also has some goats and sheep for his animal sales business. He raises them and sells them to butchers for a profit.  Nasreen assists her husband financially by sewing clothes for her neighborhood clients. She receives regular orders from her community and fulfills them on time to earn an income. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s agriculture business. With the loan, he will buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow good crops and increase his income.  Nasreen is very hopeful that an investment will bring better profits to her husband and improve his business condition. She is a regular loan user of Asasah; this is her third loan application. In every loan year, she has maintained good credit and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides

To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.
