В выборе профессии Сыпаада руководствовалась не престижем и востребованностью профессии, а тем , к чему у нее настоящая склонность и от чего она получает удовольствие. Этим занятием стало парикмахерское дело. В 17 лет Сыпаада закончила курсы обучения имиджмейкерства и парикмахерских услуг. Два года работы у опытных специалистов в столице помогло ей по возвращении в родной город Токтогул поделиться своими навыками с коллегами. Многочасовая ежедневная работа повысила привлечение клиентов. Таким образом ежемесячная прибыль для Сапаады составляет 10 000 сомов. Чем больше услуг предлагает парикмахерская, тем больше затрат она требует. Основные затраты включают оборудование, инструменты и косметические средства. Сыпаада планирует потратить этот кредит именно на приобретение дополнительных приборов для салона. Ее большая мечта – открыть свой салон красоты с высококачественным обслуживанием. 


        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
texts.en:
Sypaada J. is 19 years old, a young leader of this group. Unlike many of her peers she always knew exactly what she wants to do in life. When she chose her profession Sypaada was not driven by prestige or the demand of the profession, but rather by what she had a real aptitude for and what gave her gratification. She became a hairdresser.

When she was seventeen Sypaada finished a school of image making and hairdressing. Two years of working with experienced specialists in the country's capital helped her when she moved back to her home town of Toktogul to share her skills with her colleagues. Daily long hour shifts have increased her clientele base. Thus the monthly income for Sypaada is now 10000 soms. With more services offered in her salon there are more expenses. Most expenses include equipment, instruments and supplies. Sypaada plans to spend this loan mainly on buying additional instruments for the salon. Her biggest dream is to open her own beauty salon with highest quality service.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the hairdressing salon

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en: Hussain is a 25 year-old married man, living in Chtaoura with his wife and child. Hussain works in furniture-making.  He opened his own working place in 2010.  Hussain faced a problem at the beginning because his place isn't next to the main road.  That made it hard to find him. Now his clients know how to contact him, and it's easier than before. Hussain is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy new, updated machines necessary for his business.  These machines can help to finish the requested work in less time. This is the first time Hussain has requested a loan, and he hopes to  expand his business more in the future.  He might change his working area to a better known place, although now most of his clients know where to find him and when they recommend him to others, they lead them to his place easily.

loans.use: to buy new updated machines

loans.name: Gulnar's Group

texts.ru:
Животноводы всей страны бьют тревогу. В последние четыре года цены на корма почти утроились. 

Гульнар Нуржанова, 56, лидер этой группы. Она также стала жертвой этих экономических событий. 12 лет назад на стартовый капитал в 12 000 сомов, она приобрела двух Теленков. Целое десятилетие перепродажа скота двигалась стабильным ходом. Однако последние годы скачок в ценах на сено из- за погодных условий и дефицита воды усложнил ситуацию для животноводов. Гульнар и ее группа очень благодарны Киве за кредит. Он значительно помогает ей и членам ее группы выйти из затруднительного финансового положения. Целью данного кредита Гульнар определила покупку еще одного теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. 


        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
texts.en:
Animal husbandry workers of the entire country have sounded an alarm. In the past four years the prices for fodder have almost tripled.

Gulnar N. is 56 years old, a leader of this group. She also fell victim to these economic events. Twelve years ago her starting capital was 12000 soms when she bought two calves. For the entire decade the resale of the cattle was stable. However in the past years the hike in prices on hay due to the weather conditions and water shortages made the situation for animal husbandry workers difficult.

Gulnar and her group are very grateful to Kiva for the loan. It is significantly helping her and other members of the group to alleviate themselves from the difficult financial situation. Gulnar has defined he purpose of this loan as for purchase of another calf to increase headcount of cattle.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fuel for his fuel shop

loans.name: Akylai's Group

texts.en:
Akylai C., 43, is a leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur. She is married and has three children, the oldest of whom is 16 years old. Akylai’s husband is employed in electrical maintenance, while her mother helps Akylai in feeding and raising cattle. The idea of raising and reselling cattle was not unique or creative, because that’s the major activity for all residents in a local area. The business was started 5 years ago with an initial capital of 4,000, and now it brings Akylai twice as much per month. Akylai gathered this group of entrepreneurs in order to purchase more cattle. The expected returns from the business can be spent on purchasing an automobile, a valuable gift for her husband. 


        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fire wood for her bakery

loans.name: Enkh-Amgalan

texts.en:
Enkh-Amgalan, age 33, is from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a small house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar. His daughters, aged 9 and 13, attend public secondary school.
  
Enkh-Amgalan started his first business in 2003 at an auto market, called Da Khuree, repairing starter motors outside. He buys used starter motors to fix and renovate.  After such alterations, he sells starter motors at a higher price.  After he started the business, he rented a work space for 5 years and finally managed to buy a container on his own in 2008. Today his business has expanded and he sells different kinds of tools, equipment and starter motors at his shop. Last year, Enkh-Amgalan built a new small house with the business profits, as well as from his working capital.

Enkh-Amgalan is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to purchase more starter motors. Since he used his working capital for the house, the business profitability been lower. He wishes to expand his business and make his small house bigger so that his family can enjoy better living.

loans.use: to purchase starter motors

loans.name: Abdumumin

texts.en:
M. Abdumumin is a very loving father devoted to the needs of his children, whom he adores. He works raising livestock and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals, but in order to do this he would need to purchase livestock of better breeds and these animals are very costly. Abdumumin needs capital of $1,500 USD, and at the moment he does not have that much money, so he is requesting this loan. He hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Numon

texts.en:
Numon uses his small van as a taxi, transporting passengers around his hometown. He started driving a taxi 15 years ago. He makes around $10-$15 per day, which is enough to support himself, his wife and their two children. Numon is a positive influence on those around him and demonstrates responsibility and a good work ethic. He has requested a loan for $3,000 USD to replace his minivan with a bigger one. We are grateful for this opportunity to assist Numon with his business and to help keep him out on the road earning a living.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase a new minivan.

loans.name: Rukarara Development Group-Kihihi

texts.en:
Amiria K. is a 30 year old happily married mother of 4 high spirited kids who are all happily in school. Amiria, who is affiliated with Rukarara development group-Kihihi, has been running a food sales business for the past 2 years in Mizimera Trading center Market. Rice is what she has, for the most part, been selling, although she also has other foods for sale at her stall, such as bananas, cassava and millet.

Amiria says she began this business with savings from her erstwhile milk sales business. Many of her friends describe her as courteous, amiable, tenacious, and determined in whatever she does. Weekly, she says this business generates her shillings 20,000 as profits, and she says with this loan, she is going to purchase more bags of other cash crops such as pineapples, sorghum, maize, dried beans, etc. to resell.

In the group photo, one male member's face is slightly obscured and he has been marked as not pictured.

loans.use: to purchase other cash crops such as pineapples, sorghum, maize, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu B. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of a nephew.

Nulu has a business of a food stall. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Nulu sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. Nulu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through charcoal selling.

The main business challenge(s) for Nulu include seasonality and ever increasing prices of bananas. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to build rental houses. Nulu lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Abdukholik

texts.en:
Abdukholik is married and has three children. He sells food products in the market. Abdukholik knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them only good quality items. He has been in the food market trade for about 5 years. His business has been marked with consistent stability. 

Abdukholik is hoping to invest a loan of $2,300 USD in additional merchandise, which will help him eventually increase his turnover capital. He has a vision for the expansion of his business and we believe this loan will be helpful to his entrepreneurial endeavors. It will help Abdukholik to persist, taking small steps at a time to achieve success, which we think will be absolutely inevitable.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 59 year old business lady. She rears and sells chicken to earn a living, and has been operating the business for over ten years. She has used her previous loans from Faulu Kenya to uplift her business, which has made a big impact in her life.

She hopes to have a permanent business premise in the future. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Juliet Z.

texts.en:
This is 50 year old Juliet. She is married, and has 4 children aged 31, 29, 24 and 20. She has 5 additional dependents who live with her because they are her nieces and nephews.

In 2009, Juliet established her drug store business. She began her business because she wanted to help with medications and to get more income. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 829,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.

Juliet requires a loan in order to buy additional drugs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 165,800. In the future, Juliet plans to get a clinic of her own and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy medical drugs.

loans.name: Adjélévi

texts.fr: Madame Adjélévie a 47 ans et est mariée.  Elle a 2 enfants à charge. Pour participer au ménage, elle  fait la vente de bijoux et perle. Elle a commencé cette activité en 1985 et s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra et au Bénin à Cotonou. Ensuite elle revend au grand marché de Lomé. Elle sollicite de Wages un prêt pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Mrs. Adjélévie F. is 47 years old and is married. She takes care of two children. To cover her household expenses, she sells jewels and pearls. She has been doing that since 1985 and she gets her stock from Accra in Ghana, and Cotonou in Benin. She then sells them at the Lomé Grand Market. She is requesting a loan through WAGES so she can get more stock.

loans.use: to purchase pearls and jewelry

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 38 years old, married, and has two children. He sells shoes and clothes to earn a living. He has employed two people to help him run the business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business. He hopes that one day he will expand his business and employ more people. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy more shoes and clothes.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Afiwa Mawulawoé Epse Degbe

texts.fr: Madame  Afiwa est mère d’un enfant.  Elle a 32 ans et est mariée. Elle habite quartier  Doumasséssé.  Pour contribuer au menage, elle fait la vente de produits de beauté, bijoux et mèches. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé et revend dans une boutique à  la devanture de sa maison.  Elle compte 5 ans déjà. Pour répondre a la demande sans cesse croissante, elle demande un crédit au près de Wages.
texts.en: Mrs. L. is a mother of one. She is 32 years old and married. She lives in the Doumasséssé quater. To help handle the household expenses, she sells beauty products, jewelry, and hair extensions. She buys these items at the Lomé Grand Market and sells them at a shop in front of her house. She has been doing this for five years. To respond to an ever increasing demand, she is requesting a loan through WAGES.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products, jewelry, and hair extensions

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George S. lives with his family in Martkopi, Kartli Region. He is 30 years old and lives in his house with his wife, parents and daughter. 

George’s wife and mother are housewives and his father works in security. The total average monthly income of the family is GEL 1200, 83% of which comes from George's small business. The family has two milk cows. George sells milk to the grocery shops in Tbilisi, capital city of the country. In addition to his own cows’ production, he collects dairy products from other villagers as well and sells them in Tbilisi. For transportation of the dairy products he uses his own car. 

With the requested loan amount he plans to renovate his car. As a result of the renovation, the expenses on the car fuel will decrease significantly and will cause a 10% increase in the family’s profit. 

With the accumulated increased profit, George plans to purchase additional an milk cow for further expansion of the family's small farm.

loans.use: to renovate a car used for transportation of dairy products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 8 children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of her in-laws and her late sister’s children.

Margaret has a business of poultry farming. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. Margaret has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feed. She also generates additional income through selling piped water and renting rooms.

The main business challenge(s) for Margaret include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 2,000 laying birds and also to build more rental houses.  Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.fr: Madame Vicky est mariée avec 3 enfants à charge. Elle a 36 ans et habite quartier Hedzranawoé. Elle est revendeuse de céréales  au marché local de Hedzranawoé. Elle s’approvisionne à Notsé et cumule 11 ans dans cette activité. Elle a reçu de Wages un prêt qu’elle a déjà soldé.  Elle demande un crédit pour acheter 4 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs de gari et 2 sacs de mil.
texts.en: Mrs. S. is married with three children. She is 36 years old and lives in the Hedzranawoé quarter. She is a grain vendor at the Hedzranawoé local market. She gets her supplies in Notsé and has been selling grain for 11 years. She has already received one loan from WAGES and repaid it in full. She is requesting a loan to purchase four sacks of corn, three sacks of gari (a food made from cassava), and two sacks of millet.

loans.use: to purchase grain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more provisions and drinks.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 24 years old, married, and has three children. She has been tailoring for ten years, and has benefited by getting business loans from Faulu Kenya. She has used her previous loans to boost her business. She plans to buy more sewing machines in the future. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy fabric and threads.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

He has operated a carpentry shop for the past year, selling to the local residents. He makes furniture like beds and tables for sale. Jumaa faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in his products. 

With the Kshs 30,000 he is requesting he wants to purchase timber, glue and nails. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber, glue and nails.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 48 year old Adama S.. She is married, and has 2 children. In 2002, Adama S. established her plastic utensils business. She began her business on a very small scale with a little financial support from her husband. She opens her business 6 days a week and 10 hours a day.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000, to buy more plastic utensils. She intends to use the proceeds from this loan to help her husband educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic utensils.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida P. lives with her husband and two children in Meghri – a very southern city of Armenia. Aida is the only breadwinner in her family. For 15 years Aida has run a gift shop, and her husband used to help Aida a lot before getting ill. It took long years and lots of hard effort to get the shop premises. To be able to continue her business, it is vital for Aida to get a loan to purchase wedding accessories and gifts to sell. The loan will help Aida attract more customers, make more income to cover her family costs, and bring sustainability to her children.

loans.use: to purchase wedding accessories and gifts to sell to customers.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 23 year old single man. He has been selling second-hand clothes to earn his daily bread. He has become more focused in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya. He dreams of opening other branches for his business in the future.

He has been guaranteed a loan of 20,000 Kes by his group member in Faulu Kenya, and will use the loan to buy trousers, blouses and skirts to sell.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson O. O. is 27 years old, married, and has five children aged between nineteen and three years old, whom they hope to give a good education to the university level.

His business is located at a market at Nyalenda in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region of Kenya that harbours Lake Victoria. He owns a motorcycle which he uses for business. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for one and a half years now. He says the business is really good but the major challenge he has is being robbed of his earnings by thugs who pretend to be customers. However, he works hard to keep his business doing well.

He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy spare parts to repair the motorbike. He hopes to grow his business and even own a fleet of rickshaws in future. He describes himself as friendly.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane S. lives with two children in Shake village, Syunik region. She is a refugee, and raised her children all by herself. Although Gayane works as a waitress it is absolutely impossible to survive on that small salary. With high unemployment in the village, and her son just back from the army, Gayane would like to purchase potato seeds, saplings, fertilizer and fuel. Gayane’s son will work rolling his sleeves up to help his mother. The additional income will actually be the main income to cover the family’s costs, the young daughter’s education needs, and hopefully will serve as an investment for future expansion.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, saplings, fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: C6228  Tujyimbere Group

texts.en:
Evaliste is the president of a group called “Tujyimbere,” which has a total of fourteen members.  Evaliste is the only man in this group. He owns a small business that sells bananas. He is 29 years old and married, with three children  between 2 and 8 years old. He has had two successful years in this business and he employs one person to help him.

Evaliste and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more bananas to sell.  With any profits, Evaliste and his group would like to provide food for their families, pay school fees for their children and save for the future. Evaliste would also like to continue his studies at university.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the Ntinda neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 7 children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of grandchildren and her late sister’s children.

Rose has a business of poultry farming. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Rose sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Rose has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feed. She also generates additional income through selling school chalk and renting rooms.

The main business challenges for Rose include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 1,000 laying birds and also to build more rental houses. Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Kanoni Tweyambe Group A-Kihihi

texts.en:
Twenty-eight year old Annet A. is a tea farmer who operates from Kayonza in Kihihi district, Uganda. Annet, like many other enterprising young women in Uganda, has been striving to be an exception to the stereotype that women cannot be in charge of their destinies.

Annet, who is happily married with 6 kids, has been engaged in overseeing a tea production and sales business for the last 7 years. Through the course of these years, she has been making her own decisions on how to run her business without any help. Tea is among the highest selling cash crops in Uganda, and Annet says she has never regretted the decision she took to begin this business. At her farm, she does not just grow tea but also bananas that she also sells after harvesting.

Monthly, she says this business generates her shillings 260,000, and she says with this loan she is going to purchase fertilizers and manure to improve her yields and the fertility of her tea farm. Annet belongs to Kanoni Tweyambe group-Kihihi.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure to improve production and fertility of her tea farming gardens.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated an electronics sales shop for the past five years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Kibibi dreams of owning rental houses in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she is requesting, she wants to renovate her shop by purchasing blocks and cement and paying for labor. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase blocks and cement and to pay for labor to renovate her shop.

loans.name: Lolango Plus Group

texts.en:
Julienne is the president of the Community Bank “Lolango Plus,” composed of 15 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Julienne runs a restaurant southwest of Kinshasa. She began her business in 1984. Her beginning capital was $90. With hard work and determination, her business has prospered. Julienne is now well known and liked in this area. She has already received five times the MFI HOPE DRC loans and fully repaid them. Since that time her business has prospered, and the loans she has received have helped her rent a well-located business place. She makes about $50 profit each week. Julienne intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of her restaurant to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. She is 57 years old and married. She is the mother of seven children between the ages of 20 and 35 years old. Today, one of them attends school. Her ambition is someday to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her restaurant to meet customer demand and generate additional profits

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a member of the Kitekitu group in Faulu Kenya. He operates a boda boda (motorbike) transport business. George has two years of experience in the business and employs two people. Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, George has been motivated to work hard in his business. He is looking forward to opening other business outlets. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: Ibolya

texts.en:
Ibolya K. is a single mother who is raising her daughter herself. She works hard to ensure a decent livelihood for her small family. Ibolya started her business 12 years ago, when the used-clothing business was only getting started in Ukraine. Even today, there is still little competition at the market where she sells her inventory. This business is her family's only income.

Ibolya has used business loans before and finds them very helpful. She has been able to expand her business location from one to three sites. Ibolya is requesting a loan of 20,000 UAH to increase the variety of her inventory. She would like to purchase a new assortment of spring clothing and increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase a new assortment of spring clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en: Hussain is a 31 year-old married man living in Chtaura with his wife and child. He has worked in transportaion since 2000. He owns a small van which he uses to take people on trips all over Lebanon, in addition to others going from school or work at home. Hussain is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to do necessary maintenance to his van in addition to undergoing important medical surgery. Hussain is an honest man, well known in the region; most of his clients are relatives, friends and neighbors. He hopes to improve his business and own a big taxi or tourist company. He also hopes to provide happiness and good health to his wfe and child.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his van

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan M. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, one of whom is in school. Susan has had a restaurant business for 10 years, and she works 7 days every week. She sells her products in a retail shop. Susan has requested a loan of 900000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and chicken. She also generates additional income selling Airtime cards.

The main business challenge(s) for Susan include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to own 1000 laying birds and also to build her own house. Susan lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more food staffs like bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and chicken for her restaurant

loans.name: Manzanita Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó gracias a la señora Digna Rosa L. que vive en la cuidad de Villarrica. Encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras nombrando al grupo "Manzanita".
Las integrantes se dedican a la artesanía, especialmente a confeccionar atuendos tradicionales, ropas artesanales, por ello solicitan el crédito para poder comprar telas, lienzos, agujas especiales para este tipo de confecciones, y ao po'i.
La sra. Oilda C. es artesana desde hace mucho tiempo, ella desea poder superarse económicamente porque anhela poder brindar un futuro mejor a su familia. Sabe que es muy difícil conseguir un apoyo financiero pues ha intentado obtenerlo en otras instituciones y no lo ha logrado, por eso se encuentra muy agradecida con la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, pues en ellos encuentra la oportunidad de conseguir aumentar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Digna Rosa L. who lives in the city of Villarrica.  The women were delighted to join the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) program and named their group 'Manzanita'.

The members of this group work in handicrafts, especially making traditional outfits and hand-made clothes.  They are requesting this loan to buy fabric, linen, special needles for this type of dressmaking and ao po'i (a fine cotton cloth).

Oilda C. has been a craftswoman for a long time.  She would like to get ahead financially because she would like to be able to provide her family with a better future.  She knows that it is very difficult to get financial support since she has tried to obtain such support from other institutions and was not successful.  For this reason, she is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva because they are providing her with the opportunity to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, linen, thread and needles for working with ao po'i (fine cotton cloth)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is married to a fisherman and has two children who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Zainabu has operated a firewood and charcoal selling business from home. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business, which hopes to expand in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for sale.

loans.name: C4809 Twiyungure Group

texts.en:
Antoine is 31 years old and is married with three children. He is the president of a group which is called "Twiyungure" in the local language. The group is composed of five people: three men and two women.  Antoine is the first person on the right side.  He sells soft drinks like soda and milk.

This business is well-organized. He works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day and he has three years of experience. Antoine and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase additional drinks such as water, soda and milk to sell. With the resulting profit, Antoine and his team will be able to save in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks such as soda and milk

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married and has two children. He sells men's clothing at one of the markets in Melitopol city. He has been in this business for 12 years. He has always tried to offer his clients large variety at affordable prices. His profit is about 5,000 UAH per month. The clothing business is the only source of income for his family. Oleg uses the profit to help his parents to survive economically as well.

Oleg would like to borrow 20,000 UAH to increase his inventory. He is going to use the loan to purchase new clothing for the spring season. Oleg is very optimistic and believes he can develop his business even more.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing for the spring season

loans.name: Jafeth

texts.en:
Jafeth is a married man with three children, two boys and one girl. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

Jafeth has operated a grocery shop for the past ten years, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition and the high cost of transportation in his business. With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase a deep freezer to improve his business and meet customer demand. Jafeth decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer.

loans.name: C4706 Tuzamuranetwese Group

texts.en:
Chantal is 36 years old and married with two children. She owns a business selling foodstuffs such as sugar, rice, and salt. Chantal is the leader of the group which is called "Tuzamuranetwese" in the local language. This group contains five members: three women and two men. Chantal is in the middle raising her hand.

Chantal and her group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses through purchasing more products such as sugar, bananas, rice and salt. Through this expansion, Chantal will be able to earn more profit which will be used to pay school fees for her children and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as sugar, rice and bananas

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a thirty-five-year-old married man with six children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in motorcycle transport for five years with minimal hardships. His dream is having four motorcycles and educating his children. Julius needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Atanacio

texts.es:
Atanacio tiene 56 años está casado con la Sra. Adela, tienen dos hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes, viven en casa propia.
Atanacio se dedicaba antes a la compostura de zapatos, hace más de 15 años, es uno de los pioneros de la zona, hoy día cuenta con una despensa desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, la cual es atendida por él y su cónyuge, cuentan con una clientela formada. Atanacio es una persona muy reconocida en la zona por la buena calidad de sus productos.
El necesita el crédito para la compra de mercadería en general como arroz, fideo, azucar, productos lácteos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Atanacio is 56 years old. He is married to Adela and they have two children who are grown and independent. They live in their own home. 

Previously, more than 15 years ago, Atanacio worked making shoes. He was one of the pioneers in the area. Today he has a grocery store, which he has had for approximately 10 years. He and his wife work there, and they have regular customers. Atanacio is well known in his area for the good qualities of his products. He needs the loan to buy general merchandise such as rice, pasta, sugar, and dairy products, among others.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (rice, pasta, sugar, and dairy products, among others).

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam A. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, one of whom is in school. Mariam also takes care of her mother. Mariam lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

Mariam has a business selling secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. Mariam sells her products door-to-door, at retail prices. Mariam has requested a loan of 60,0000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Mariam's main business challenge is the rainy season. Her goals and hopes are to start importing clothes for her business and to build her own house. .

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: For the past 5 years, Elchin A. has put much effort into his agricultural activities. Despite the difficult economic situation that he has gone through, he has managed to support his family and provide his three daughters with everything they need. To develop his business, Elchin  applied for a loan from AqroInvest Credit Unions which he will use for  technical assistance for his crops. He will invest his loan to grow his crops, later raise his harvest, and survive along with his family. With your help, Elchin will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 42 years old, married and the father of four children. He has been operating a retail shop for 5 years. With the income from his business, he is able to educate his children. Through Faulu Kenya, Paul has managed to buy a piece of land. He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future. Paul has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy cereals and kerosene.

loans.use: to buy cereals and kerosene

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Pauline has operated a tailoring business for the past ten years; neighboring members are her potential customers. Pauline faces a major challenge of seasonality. During festive season, the demand is high while during the months of January to May, the demand is low. Pauline will use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase cloth materials for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is married to a driver and has two children, both adults. The family owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Tatu's greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Tatu has operated a retail shop, selling household goods such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. In addition, she operates a grocery shop which contributes as another source of income. 

Tatu is planning to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of sugar and cooking oil. Tatu decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Yoweri

texts.en: Yoweri is a thirty-three year-old married man with one child.  He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running an electronics shop where he repairs computers and phones, and he has been in business for four years. He has a challenge of power shortages. His dream is to set up a vocational school for electronic repairs and selling computers and phones. Yower intends to use the loan to buy computers and phones.

loans.use: Buying computers and phones

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 53 years old, married and a father of six.  He does poultry farming for a living.  He has been in the business for almost one year.  Besides that, he sells milk, and he is employed.  With his monthly income, he is able to educate his children.  He hopes to start large-scale livestock farming in the future.  He has requested for 20 000 Kes to buy chicks.

loans.use: To buy chicks

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Candida tiene 59 años y está casada, posee casa propia en la ciudad de Paraguari.
Candida se dedica a la producción y ventas de hortalizas desde hace más de 20 años con la ayuda de su marido, poseen su propia huerta, la actividad de la señora empieza a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para transladarse con sus productos al mercado municipal de la ciudad de Paraguarí, donde tiene su puesto de ventas.
Todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y trabajan por cuenta propia.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de electrodomésticos.
texts.en: Candida is 59 years old and married.  She owns her own home in the city of Paraguarí.  Candida has been producing and selling vegetables for more than 20 years, with her husband's help.  They own their own vegetable garden.  Candida gets up very early in the morning to transport her produce to the municipal market in Paraguarí where she has her sales stall.  All of her children are grown up and work.  Candida plans to use her loan to buy household electrical appliances.

loans.use: to buy household electrical appliances

loans.name: Pimwa

texts.en: Pimwa is a thirty-seven year-old married man, with four children.  He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in his retail shop for seven years.  He started with capital of 300,000 shillings and now has 1,000,000 shillings. His hardship is high transportation costs, and his vision is to become a wholesaler.  Pimwa needs the loan to buy iron sheets, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Bokoli Plus Group

texts.en:
Mado T. is a chairwoman of a Community bank, named “Bokoli Plus”. The group is composed of 14 microentrepreneurs jointly united to receive loans from Kiva, through IMF HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses.

Mado started has been in business since 1980 selling slippers. Today, she operates a general store and she also sells charcoal. She is 56 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 14 and 33. One of her children still goes to school. Her store has prospered, thanks to Hope’s loans. With the profit of about $20 earned per day, she increased her working capital. Currently, Mado is happy to be part of one of MFI Hope’s groups.  She joined the group in 2009 and her business has been reinforced through the eleven loans she received from MFI Hope DRC. She has repaid each loan properly. With the next loan, she intends to diversify her business by purchasing some crates of soft drinks and other items in order to increase the profits. Her dream is to open a larger store. Her business is located in the western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of the store in order to reinforce the working capital.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Neckson

texts.en: Neckson is a thirty year-old married man with three children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in his retail shop for ten years after raising money from farming.  His hardships include debtors, price fluctuation and high transport costs.  His vision is a wholesale business and educating his children.  Neckson needs the loan to buy iron sheets to sell.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets (roofing) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kanoni Tweyambe Group B-Kihihi

texts.en: Marble M., 28 years old,  has been in the retail business for 6 years, operating out of the Kanoni Trading Center-Kihihi. The happily married mother of 6 sells a variety of general merchandise items which are in high favor with many people around the area. Marble also farms, harvesting some of the crops she grows such as beans and cassava, which she sells to supplement her profits. She says that hard work is what has kept her business afloat in an increasingly competitive business genre. Her business generates 160,000 UGX weekly.  Marble plans to use this loan to purchase more general merchandise items to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more general merchandise items

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
Doña María, de 70 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive junto a una hija de 36 años de edad, se dedican a la venta de comida, pupusas y refrescos, este negocio fue fundado hace 12 años. Juntas trabajan todos los días de la semana, de 5:00am a 3:00pm, la ventaja es que no existen negocios similares en la zona. 
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar: arroz, frijoles, aceite, entre otros, estos productos son para la venta de comida ya que son parte del menú que ofrece a los clientes; este préstamo le ayudara a mantener el negocio y seguir obteniendo ganancias las cuales serán utilizados para cubrir sus gastos cotidianos.
Ella aspira mantenerse en el negocio, brindar un buen servicio a la clientela  y aumentar su aporte para solventar los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
70 year-old María lives in San Miguel together with her 36 year-old daughter.  Their business is selling meals, pupusas and soft drinks.  They started the business 12 years ago.  María and her daughter work together every day of the week, from 5.00am to 3.00pm.  Their advantage is that there are no similar businesses in the area.

María is currently requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, etc.  She needs these products for her meals business since they are part of the menu that she offers her customers.  This loan will help her to keep her business running and continue making profits which she will use to cover her daily expenses.

María's goals are to keep going in her business, to provide a good service to her customers and to increase her contribution in covering her family expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and oil

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: Pablo Antonio tiene 51 años. Es un hombre muy trabajador. Se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, el tiene 18 años de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que logro mantener a sus clientes ofreciéndoles buena calidad en lo que ofrece, ya que es por medio de este trabajo es que sus hijos han logrado tener la oportunidad de estudiar, el siempre disfruta de su trabajo ya que recorre muchos lugares y así le da la facilidad de conocer más clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para invertir en la compra de calzado, cosméticos, cremas, tratamientos, bolsos, toallas, camisas entre otras cosas. El sueña con mantener siempre activo este financiamiento ya que son muy necesarios para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Pablo Antonio is 51 years old.  He is a hardworking man.  He sells general merchandise.  His 18 years of experience allow him to offer his clients good quality, and his earnings have allowed his children to study.  He always enjoys his work, since he gets to go to many places and meet many clients.  

He is requesting a loan for working capital to invest in buying footwear, cosmetics, creams, ointments, bags, towels, and t-shirts, among other things.  He hopes he can always keep this financing going because it is so necessary to the development of his business.

loans.use: to buy footwear, cosmetics, creams, ointments, bags, towels, and t-shirts

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 35 años y está casado con la Sra. Brigida, quien es comerciante y posee una cantina en la escuela enfrente a su casa y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Carlos se dedica al ramo de pintura de obras desde hace más de 15 años, aprendió el oficio de su tío con quien se fue a trabajar en Argentina, después de terminar sus estudios secundarios.
Actualmente posee su propia casa y desde hace aproximadamente cinco años sus trabajos los realiza en forma independiente y con sus propios recursos.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de una heladera para su domicilio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old and is married to Brigida, who is a trader and has a canteen in the school in front of their house to help with the household expenses.

Carlos has been a painter for more than 15 years.  He learned the business from his uncle, with whom he went to work in Argentina, after finishing secondary school.

He now has his own home and for the last five years has been working on his own using his own resources.

He will use the loan to buy a refrigerator for his house.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Gerardo Oswaldo

texts.es:
Gerardo, es un joven de 22 años, vive con su joven esposa y tienen una hija de 6 meses de nacida, residen en  San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, él se dedica a trabajar en una moto taxi, transportando personas para diferentes zonas del municipio, tiene un año de estar dedicado al transporte, dicho moto taxi fue comprado junto a su padre, pero Gerardo también realiza trabajos de albañilería, cuando los realiza tiene un horario de 5:00am a 6:00pm.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para el mantenimiento de la moto taxi, ya que en ella realiza la mayor parte de su trabajo, por lo que desea garantizar un viaje seguro y cómodo a los clientes, esta revisión y reparación la llevara a cabo por el monto del préstamo.
Él tiene como aspiraciones: con el préstamo pues lograr el buen funcionamiento de la moto taxi, proveer para su familia todo lo necesario para sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Gerardo, is a young man who is 22 years old. He lives with his young wife and they have a 6 month old daughter. They live in San Rafael Oriente, departament of San Miguel. He works in a motorcyle taxi, transporting people to different areas in town. He has been working in transportation for one year. The motorcyle taxi was bought together with his father, but Gerardo also does bricklaying work. When he is doing that, his schedule is from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

At this time, he is asking for a loan to do maintenance on the motorcycle taxi, since he does most of his work in it. With this, he hopes to guarantee a safe and comfortable for his customers. This maintenance and repair will be done for the amount of the loan. 

His aspirations are: with the loan, to have his motorcycle taxi work well to provide his family with everything it needs to survive.

loans.use: to do maintenance on a motorcycle taxi.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit to make juice and also bags of water to sell

loans.name: Las Consentidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CONSENTIDAS” iniciará un nuevo proceso más en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por once integrantes, las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva que tiene como presidenta la señora Elizabeth.

La señora Elizabeth, indica que es el primer ciclo de trabajo con la A.C. “Las Consentidas” y menciona que con el préstamo piensa ampliar su producción de costura, mediante la compra de telas. Nos comenta que los clientes van a su domicilio y que allí realiza la venta de sus confecciones. Esta forma de trabajo le ayudará a apoyar un poco más a su familia.

Con respecto a las integrantes de la asociación, podemos decir que ellas llevan adelante  variados tipos de negocios, los que son: Venta de mantas, , venta de abarrotes, venta de verduras, comerciante de chompas, venta de material escolar, costura, venta de coca, venta de calzados.
texts.en:
The A.C. “Las Consentidas” (“The Pampered Ones” Communal Association) will start yet another cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. It is composed of eleven members, guided by a directive board presided over by Elizabeth.

Elizabeth says this is her first working cycle with the “Las Consentidas” Communal Association, and she says that with the loan she is requesting she will increase her sewing production by buying cloths. She told us that her customers go to her house where she sells the clothes she creates. This job will help her sustaining her family a little more.

As for the members of the group, it can be said that they engage in various kinds of activities, such as: blankets sale, grocery store, vegetables sale, jumpers sale, school supplies sale, sewing, cocoa sale, shoes sale.

loans.use: To buy cloth to produce clothes.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married and has five children, three adult-aged and two attending school. The family owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Ruth's greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Ruth has operated a poultry business for the past eight years, selling from home to her neighbors and close friends. Ruth experiences difficulties in times of poultry disease outbreak. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Ruth plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase chicken feed. Ruth decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to  purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Jairo Alberto

texts.es: Jairo Alberto es un hombre responsable y que busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos pues él se encuentra muy emocionado con este crédito que es una oportunidad para salir adelante con su negocio. El se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de tricitaxi, hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ha buscado la forma de mejorar sus ingresos de la mejor manera posible de mantener a su hijo menor de edad y su esposa. La mayoría de sus clientes se sienten satisfecho por el servicio que ofrece. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como llantas, tapizar asientos, y realizarle reparaciones a su medio de transporte entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Jairo Alberto is a responsible man who is looking for a way to improve his income.  As a result, he is very excited to be receiving this loan as it represents an opportunity to get ahead in his business which is offering a 'tricitaxi' service.  He has been in this business for more than four years.  Jairo Alberto looks for ways to improve his income so that he can support his dependent son and wife in the best way possible.  Most of his customers are satisfied with the service that he offers.  He will use his loan to buy tires, to upholster his seats, to have some repairs done on his vehicle, etc.

loans.use: to buy tires, to upholster his seats and to have some repairs done on his vehicle

loans.name: Josue Manuel

texts.es:
Josué es un joven de 20 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive junto a su madre, es soltero, él administra una tienda, negocio que nace hace 3 años, ya que en un inicio fuera de su madre quien lo mantuvo por 15 años, luego de ser  de Josué, este joven se empeña cada día en tener lo mejor en el negocio, atendiéndolo de 5:0am a 7:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería arroz, azúcar, aceite, papel, frijoles, embutidos, entre otros, esta  ayuda fortalecerá el negocio y obtendrá mejores beneficios, ya que contara con la preferencia de los clientes, y estos le darán una mayor rentabilidad.
Su objetivo es mantenerse en el negocio, realizarse inversiones que lo fortalezcan y les brinde seguridad y solvencia económica para él y su madre.
texts.en:
20 year-old Josué is a young man who lives in San Rafael Oriente, in San Miguel department.  He is single and lives with his mother.  Josué runs a store and started his business three years ago.  His mother supported him for 15 years and then it was his turn to support himself.  This young man strives  every day to put his best into his business.  He works from 5.00am to 7.00pm.

Josué is requesting a loan to buy merchandise: rice, sugar, oil, paper, beans, sausages, and other products.  This help will strengthen his business and he will make better profits since he has loyal customers who will make his business more profitable.

Josué's goals are to keep going in his business, to make investments that strengthen his business and to provide himself and his mother with financial security and solvency.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: rice, sugar, oil, paper, beans, sausages, etc.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Sara Cecilia

texts.es:
Doña Sara, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, tienen casa propia y se dedican a la siembra de maíz, chile y pipián, este trabajo lo desarrollan doña Sara con su esposo, y hasta el momento este es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuentan.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para el cultivo, comprando fertilizantes y abono para dar los cuidos necesarios y poder obtener una buena cosecha, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la producción.
Su objetivo es tener una buena cosecha, que puedan comercializarla y por la que puedan también recibir buenas ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Sara lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  She is 48 years old and lives with her husband and children.  They own their own home and farm corn, chilis and 'pipián' (a type of squash).  Sara and her husband both carry out this work and it is their only source of income.

Sara is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies.  She will buy fertilizers and manure so that they can take the necessary care of their crops and obtain a good harvest.  This loan will help her to improve her production.

Sara's goal is to have a good harvest whose crops they can sell and make good profits from.  This will enable her to cover their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rehema has operated a beauty salon for the past ten years; her potential customers are the neighboring community. Rehema faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of adding more stock to her beauty salon in the future. Rehema plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase chemicals and cosmetics for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and cosmetics

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Manuel, es un señor de 64 años de edad, reside en Concepción Batres departamento de Usulután, vive con su familia: esposa e hijos, se dedica a la venta de medicina hace 15 años, trabaja todos los días de la semana y su esposa es un gran apoyo para realizar las ventas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en medicina para mejorar el negocio, esta inversión le ayudara a tener más mercadería y variedad de producto medicinales, generando más ventas y ganancias.
El objetivo de don Manuel con respecto al préstamo es cancelar oportunamente, tener un buen historial crediticio y fortalecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 64 year-old gentleman who lives in Concepción Batres, in Usulután department.  He lives with his family: wife and children.  He has been selling medicines for 15 years.  He works every day of the week and his wife is a great support in helping him make his sales.

Manuel is currently requesting a loan to invest in buying medicines to improve his business.  This investment will help him to have more merchandise and a greater variety of medicinal products.  This will enable him to make more sales and profits.

Manuel's goal with respect to his loan is to repay it on time, create a good credit history and strengthen his business.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Evelyn Cecilia

texts.es:
Evelyn de 39 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y su hija de 10 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa, este negocio lo inicio de forma ambulante y hoy tiene un local en el mercado municipal de Jiquilisco.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa, ayudando así al fortalecimiento del negocio y ofrecer una gran variedad de prendas de vestir.
Su objetivo es continuar luchando por mejorar el negocio, volverlo cada día más rentable y con más oportunidades de superación para ella y su hija.
texts.en:
39 year-old Evelyn lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  She lives with her husband and 10 year-old daughter.  Evelyn's business is selling clothes.  She started out making her sales door to door but now she has a stall in Jiquilisco town market.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to buy clothes.  This will help her to strengthen her business and enable her to offer a wide range of clothes to her customers.

Evelyn's goal is to continue working hard to improve her business, to make it more and more profitable and to provide herself and her daughter with more opportunities to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 48-year-old member of the Siathani group in Faulu Kenya.  He sells livestock and agricultural chemicals and does dairy farming. Being a married man with four children in school, he works hard to provide the best education for his children. Stephen previously earned a living from his rental houses. He hopes to move into a more spacious business premise in the future. Stephen has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy agro-chemicals and cows.

loans.use: to buy agro-chemicals and cows

loans.name: C4906 Urugwiro Group

texts.en:
Julienne is 33 years old and is married with two children. In this family, only Julienne works. Julienne is a businesswoman selling beans and cassava. Julienne is the leader of this group which is called "Urugwiro". The group contains four women and one man. Julienne is the first person on the left side.

Julienne and her group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products such as beans, cassava, etc. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and to save her future.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as beans, cassava, etc.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel Antonio está casado desde hace 10 años, tiene 3 hijos menores a su cargo. El se dedica a una pulpería, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su vivienda  de esta manera puede aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a con los gastos del hogar. El manifiesta que la única forma de crecimiento es a través de los créditos, porque le resulta muy difícil conseguir acumular el capital operativo. Razón por el cual necesita el crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos, detergentes, gaseosas y jugos. El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que vaya a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en: Miguel Antonio has been married for 10 years and has 3 young children in his care.  His business is a grocery store which is located in his home.  This allows him to increase his income and help with household expenses.  He says that the only way to grow his business is through loans because it is very difficult to accumulate operating capital.  For this reason, Miguel Antonio needs a loan to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, basic grains, detergents, soda and juice.  He is a very responsible person who has a desire to improve himself.  He has a jovial and enterprising spirit and there can be no doubt that he will manage to achieve all the goals that he has set himself.

loans.use: to buy candy, bread, basic grains, detergents, soda and juice

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is married and lives with her husband and five children; three are her own while two are adopted. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, food and rent bills. 

Emmah has operated a stationery and office supplies shop for the last seven years, selling in a shop to local residents. Emmah faces a challenge of competition from similar operators in her location. She dreams of expanding and establishing another shop in the future. Emmah plans to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase a laser jet printer and stationery. Emmah decided to join Yehu because of the availability of sustainable financial services to esteemed customers.

loans.use: to purchase a laser jet printer and stationery

loans.name: C 4905 Twumvikane Group

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 34 years old and married. He has two children, aged between 4 and 7 years old. He is the president of the group which is called "TWISUNGANE" in the local language. Jean Paul is the first person on the left side. He owns a business selling foodstuffs such as sugar, rice, salt, etc.  This group contains six members: four women and two men. 

Jean Paul and his group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his businesses through purchasing more goods such as: sugar, soap, rice and salt. Through this expansion, Jean Paul will be able to earn more profit, which will allow him to save in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as: sugar, rice, soap, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Fuente De Vida 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is one of the member's group called Fuente de Vida (Source of Life), which is located in the rural outskirts of La Romana. She lives in a 'batey,' a community set up for workers who cut sugarcane in the blistering Dominican sun. This village was built for the sugarcane workers and their families. 
Despite the remoteness of these communities, Maria says she is happy to be able to live with her husband and two children of the 5 they have, in their small home. 

Maria is excited to take her third loan with Esperanza after having 2 years running this business. She started cooking and selling a dish called 'Pico y Pala', stir-fry using all of the chicken except for the breasts, wings and thighs. Now she has a fried food stall, where she sells different meats, plantain, fried round dough, and many other fried foods,. With this loan Maria is planning to buy all of the ingredients and she also she wants to start selling french fries. Her most difficult challenge is to have her own house. She like to listen music, and her dreams are to have her own house and to expand her fried food stall into a restaurant.  She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy chicken, plantain, oil, plates, potatoes, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and start a charcoal selling business.

loans.name: Saul Humberto

texts.es:
Don Saúl, reside en San Miguel, tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su familia, posee una llantería, negocio que atiende de 7:00am a 5:00pm, la ubicación del  negocio le permite tener clientes ya que está instalado en la calle única que conectan a dos departamentos, esto le ayuda para tener un mayor movimiento de ventas.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de llantas, fortaleciendo el negocio para que los clientes encuentren de los diferentes tipos de llantas y tamaños, adecuados para las diferentes marcas de automóviles.
La aspiración de él es poseer en un futuro un nuevo local, administrando los dos paralelamente.
texts.en:
Mr. Saúl is 45 years old and lives with his family in San Miguel.  He runs a tire business which is open from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  The location of his business is good for customer access and sales since it is on the only street that connects two departments.

In order to strengthen his business he is requesting a loan to buy tires in a variety of types and sizes for different kinds of automobiles to meet customer demand. 

His goal for the future is to open another sales outlet and be able to manage both businesses at the same time.

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married with one child who attends school. Her husband is a judiciary officer and he contributes to his family's basic needs. Lucia has operated a business of selling bags and belts from door to door to local residents for the past two years. 

Lucia dreams of establishing a large scale business in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase bags and belts for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of its variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase bags and belts for sale.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is 44 years old and  married, with one child who is four years old. He and his wife work hard for the development of their family. Simeon owns a business selling bananas. His business is well-known, as well as organized. He employs one person as  a helper. Simeon has three years experience in his business. The hours of his business are from 7am until 8pm every day. 

Simeon has requested his first loan from KIva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase a  large quantity of bananas. That will help him to satisfy his many customers. Simeon will able to earn more profits to be reinvested in his business and he will pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: To purchase a large of quantity of bananas.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is too young for school. Lucia has operated a hawking business of house hold commodities and a tailoring business for the past five years. 

She has been able to provide basic needs to her family from the income gained in her business. Lydia faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and household goods. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and household goods.

loans.name: Yrupe Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de independizarse creando sus propios negocios  y otras para emprender en actividades productivas, de ahí que coordinaron la reunión para comunicar sobre el programa que se ofrece, les pareció muy importante e interesante por los beneficios brindados por la Fundación Paraguaya.
El comité lleva por nombre Yrupe, todas son vecinas y parientes, actualmente se encuentran en el tercer ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 11 señoras, quienes se esmeran día a día para aumentar sus ingresos y  brindar lo mejor a sus respectivas familias.
La Sra. Apolinaria es la presidenta del grupo, se dedica en venta de leche y queso. Desea invertir el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus vacas y el mejoramiento del tambo, ella está muy orgullosa por ser parte de la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
In the town of Paraguari, a few women got together in order to obtain economic independence, some by establishing their own activities and others by embarking on profitable activities. They organized a meeting to talk about the program offered by Fundación Paraguaya, and they found the proposed benefits to be very important and interesting.
