The group is called Yrupe, all the members are neighbors or relatives, and they are currently working their third cycle with an excellent result. The group is composed of 11 women who day by day do their best to increase their earnings and to offer all the best to their families.
Apolinaria is the president of the group. She engages in selling milk and cheese. She wants to invest the loan amount in the purchase of animal feed for her cows and to improve her dairy farm. She is really proud to be a member of Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her cows and to improve her dairy farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To plaster and grout the house

loans.name: Dios Es Bueno 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of her group Dios es bueno 4 & 5 (God is Great). She makes her home here in a simple structure with two children and her long term partner. She plans to continue enjoying being at home with her children and doing business.

Margarita is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for one and a half years, starting out with some savings she had accumulated. In less than 4 months, she joined this group for a loan to increase her sales. Margarita plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing chains, bracelets, rings, earrings and plastic jewels. She will use the profits to invest in her business. She would like to have an improved business and to travel to different countries.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to expand her business and needed the capital to increase her sales. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with eleven children, ten of whom attend school, while one is married. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She has operated a vegetable stall business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Fatuma joined Yehu microfinance to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos tiene 33 años y vive con su esposa en el barrio de Villanueva. Pues ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y disfruta tener este medio de vida como es una pulpería y brindar el servicio de transporte. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que es inicio cuando su Papa ya no podía trabajar es por eso que Juan se quedo con este negocio del servicio de taxi, pues anteriormente él se dedicaba a una pulpería, con el paso del tiempo es que ha ido creciendo con esta actividad. El señor Juan Carlos utilizara el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos, detergentes, llantas, repuestos para su vehículo y así poder tener mejores ganancias. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, su meta es que su negocio sea grande y que tenga mucha variedad de productos para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes, también nos comento que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 33 years old and lives with his wife in Villanueva neighborhood.  He has shown himself to be a very responsible person and he enjoys his line of work which is running a grocery store and providing transport services.  He has been in this business for more than 11 years.  He started out when his dad could no longer work.  This is why Juan took over the taxi service.  He previously had a grocery store but over time he grew in this business as well.

Juan Carlos will use his loan to invest in buying candy, soft drinks, bread, basic grains and detergents, as well as tires and spare parts for his vehicle.  This will enable him to make more profits.  His business is located in his home and his goal is for his business to grow and have a large variety of products that will cover all his customers' demands.  He tells us that he would also like to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, basic grains and detergents, as well as tires and spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Pedro Armando

texts.en: Pedro is 25 years old, married, and has one child. He works in clothing manufacturing and has been in the business for 7 years. He started out working in this business as a machine operator and now runs his own operation. His wife also works manufacturing clothing. Pedro is requesting a loan to purchase fabric to manufacture more t-shirts for his business. In the future, he would like to run a larger business and hire more employees. This is Pedro´s third loan through ASDIR, and the previous two loans were paid back in full.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Mechansm United-Kyenjojo Group

texts.en: 27 year-old Nasuru R.  is a businessman dealing in metals and car tires in Kyenjojo Trading center. He has been involved in this business for close to 8 years now. He began this business after graduating from technical college. He had no previous business experience but he had the courage and conviction that he would succeed as long as the determination was there. He sells car tires to motorists in Kyenjojo and also in neighboring districts. Weekly, he makes shillings 150,000 as profit. The happily married father of 2 says he is going to use this loan to purchase more tires to resell at his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more tires to resell

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married and her husband is a driver by profession. He contributes to his family's basic needs with his earnings. She has operated a vegetable stall business for over ten years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and onions for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Esmilce Jamileth

texts.es:
La Doctora Esmilce Jamileth  de 31 años de edad, su compañero de vida lo ayuda con el pago de las cuotas ya que son bien unido y aun no tienen hijos por lo tanto solamente sus gastos personales y los gastos de sus estudios, ella trabaja como medico general del Minsa desde hace 4 años, actualmente esta estudiando una maestria , ella es una joven que ha luchado por culminar sus estudios universitarios, muy responsable y bien querida, proviene de una familia humilde pero con comodidades que han mejorado atravez del tiempo con creditos.  

Solicita su cuarto crèdito para realizarle un anexo a su vivienda ya que es muy pequeña, esta agradecida con Kiva ya que gracias al credito anterior pudo poner piso y reppelar su habitacion.  

Su mayor sueño es acondicionar su vivienda y mejorarla que no le falte el trabajo para el sustento del pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Dr. Esmilce Jamileth is 31 years old and lives with her partner who helps her cover expenses.  They have no children yet and only have personal expenses and education costs.  She has worked for four years as a general doctor at Minsa and is currently studying to be a teacher.  She struggled to complete her college education and is very responsible and well-loved.  She comes from a modest family but has been able to improve her lifestyle thanks to loans.

She is requesting her fourth loan to pay for house expansion since her house is very small.  She is grateful to Kiva for the previous loan that helped her put in flooring and plaster.

Her dream is to make home improvements and continue working to put food on the table every day.

loans.use: To pay for house expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy insecticides to protect his crops from insect infestations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bundle of fish for sale.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is 41 years old and married, with four children between 2 and 15 years old. She owns a business selling clothes. Her business is open from 8am to 6pm every day, and she employs one person to help her. Marceline has two years experience in this business.  

Marceline has requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, for the purpose of expanding her business by purchasing more clothes to sell.  Through this expansion, Marceline will be able to earn more profit, which will be used as savings for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with nine school-going children. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours. Dama faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nueva Vida  1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Patria is one of the members of the "Nueva vida" 1 y 2 *New Life* group, a group in which the majority are Haitian immigrants who live in the city of La Romana, where the economy depends on the sugar industry and on luxury tourism. It is becoming one of the most exclusive destinations in the Dominican Republic. There is a scarcity of potable water and of electricity, and there is a population of people from the Dominican Republic and Haitian immigrants. Their principle activity is new clothing sales.

Patria is a single mom with three children. Her most difficult challenge has been to work for her children, in a different country with a different culture. She really enjoys working, and she doesn´t know what is to be lazy at home. Unless she is sick, she needs to be doing something, selling or doing household activities.

Patria is very excited to receive her first loan from Esperanza International. She has had her business for about 10 years, when she began selling miscellaneous products. She is planning to invest her loan in the purchase of new clothes, especially spring and summer clothing. Easter is close and the weather is very warm; people are waiting to go to the beach and use light clothing. She plans to use her earnings to reinvest in her business and to provide all they need as a family. Thank you so much for supporting this group.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jean  Nepomuseni

texts.en:
Jean Nepomuseni is 39 years old and married. He has owned a motorcycle transport business that is open daily from 6am until 10pm for two years. His business is well-organized.

Jean Nepomuseni has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of buying material for his business. With any profits, Jean Nepomuseni will build his own house and save for his future.

loans.use: To buy materials for his business.

loans.name: Ana Sugey

texts.es:
Anna Sugey de 29  años de edad trabaja como conserje desde hace  4 años en la Financiera FAMA, ella vive con sus padres  ya que aun no ha formado su propia familia, es muy responsable con sus obligaciones de pago ademas muy trabajadora ha luchado para obtener lo que tiene y darles lo mejor a su familia, los gastos son compartidos en conjunto con sus padres.  

Solicita  su tercer crèdito para repellar y arenillar una habitaciòn ya que con el crèdito anterior logro  construir  la habitaciòn, agradece al Fondo Kiva por este apoyo y espera ser beneficiada nuevamente.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida  es que sus padre gocen de salud y tener estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Anna Sugey is 29 years old and has worked as a concierge at FAMA financial entity for four years.  She lives with her parents since she has not formed her own family yet.  She is very responsible with her payment commitments and is a hard worker.  She has struggled to get ahead and provide the best to her family with whom she shares expenses.

She is requesting her third loan to plaster and grout a room.  With a previous loan she was able to build the room.  She is grateful to Kiva for this support and hopes to receive their help once again.

Her dream is for her parents to remain healthy and for her to have stability in her job.

loans.use: To plaster the walls of a room

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is married to a driver and they have three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a beauty salon, which has helped her provide basic needs and educate her children. Her potential customers are women for hair dressing. She dreams of establishing another beauty salon in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon. Zubeda decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: San Buenaventura Group

texts.es:
En la zona denominada Peguajho, ciudad de Paraguari, se reunieron un grupo de mujeres con el fín de interiorizarse sobre el programa ofrecido por la Fundación Paraguaya, resultándoles una excelente oportunidad, decidieron realizar la reunión para la conformación del comité.   
El comite lleva por nombre San Buenaventura por haberse creado en fecha próxima a la celebración del día del Santo patrono de dicha ciudad, ellas se comprometen a mantenerse unidas y trabajar bajo un marco de respeto mútuo entre todas, actualmente se encuentran en el  sexto ciclo con calificación excelente.
La sra. Feliciana se dedica a vender comestibles preparados por ella misma, es una mujer muy sacrificada pero desea poder prosperar junto con su familia, trabaja mucho para poder pagar sus deudas en tiempo y forma, ella espera que los inversionistas puedan apoyarle económicamente mediante Kiva. Si se le otorga el crédito lo invertiría en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los comestibles que luego vende.
texts.en:
In the Peguajho area of the town of Paraguari a group of women met in order to familiarize themselves with the program offered by Fundación Paraguaya; as it seemed to be an excellent opportunity for them, they decided to meet again to discuss the structure of the group.
The group was named San Buenaventura for having been established on a date close to Paraguari’s Patron Saint’s celebration day. They commit to keeping together and to working in mutual respect of all the members, and they are currently working their sixth cycle with an excellent result.
Feliciana engages in selling food she herself prepares. She is a very self-sacrificing woman, but she desires to prosper together with her family. She works a lot in order to be able to punctually repay her debts, and she hopes the lenders will be able to help her through Kiva. If the loan is granted to her, she will invest it in the purchase of ingredients to prepare the food that she sells.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to preare meals to sell.

loans.name: Las 7 Alpaquitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS 7 ALPAQUITAS” iniciará el ciclo número cuatro en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva, que tiene como presidenta la señora Juana.   

La señora Juana, indica que trabaja con Pro Mujer dos ciclos ocupando la responsabilidad de la presidencia de la A.C. “LAS 7 ALPAQUITAS” en esta ocasión. Ella nos cuenta que su negocio se basa en la venta de carne de oveja y aveces queso, el cual inicio hace un año. Con el crédito que ahora esta solicitando piensa comprar carne, la que venderá en la calle 7 de la zona 12 de octubre; en la actualidad no cuenta con un puesto de venta fijo por lo que debe buscar uno espacio libre diariamente. La señora Juana es soltera y con el negocio que tiene apoya a su hija de 21 años.

Con respecto a las integrantes de la asociación, podemos decir que ellas llevan adelante  variados tipos de negocios, los que son: Venta puertas y muebles, venta de faldas, costura de faldas, venta de calzados, venta de tomates, venta de frutas, venta de CD’s.
texts.en:
The “LAS 7 ALPAQUITAS” (The 7 Little Alpacas) communal bank will start its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board chaired by Juana, President.

Juana indicates that she’s worked with Pro Mujer for two cycles and on this occasion has the position of President of the Las 7 Alpaquitas communal bank.  She tells us that her business is based on the sale of lamb meat and sometimes cheese; she started it a year ago.  With the loan she’s asking for now she will buy meat that she’ll then sell on 7th Street in the 12 de October zone.  She currently does not have a fixed sales stand so has to look for available space daily.  Juana is single and she supports her 21 years old daughter with the business she has.

With respect to the other group members, we can say that they are in a variety of businesses, like: sale of doors and furniture, skirt sales, skirt making, shoe sales, tomato sales, fruit sales and CD sales.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bundle of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Reynaldo Antonio

texts.es: Reynaldo Antonio se dedica a la renta de apartamentos. Tiene más de 21 años en este negocio, inicio este negocio como un medio de ingreso para su hogar, pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar fuertemente pues no tiene un trabajo que le genere ingresos diarios. La mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos con su medio de ingreso.  El crédito será invertido en la compra de camas, sabanas, colchones, entre otros arreglos necesarios. Sueña con construir un hotel y obtener más ingresos.
texts.en: Reynaldo Antonio's business is renting apartments.  He has been in this business for more than 21 years.  He started the business as a way of making income for his household.  Reynaldo Antonio has always enjoyed working hard.  He does not have a job that makes him daily income.  Most of his customers are satisfied with his means of income.  He will invest his loan in buying beds, sheets, mattresses and other necessary items.  He dreams of building a hotel and making more income.

loans.use: to buy beds, sheets, mattresses and other necessary items

loans.name: Lilliam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lilliam de 37 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos  ambos estudian , ella se siente muy agradecida con los hijos que Dios  le ha dado, su esposo trabaja como director de una Radio ambos comparten con los gastos familiares del hogar, ella labora como directora del Colegio Cesar Augusto Salinas  Pinell desde hace 15 años,  Lilliam es una mujer profesional que recientemente se acaba de recibir de master, es una docente  muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajos, alumnos y por su familia por ser bien sociable.                                                                                          

Solicita su 9no credito para mejorar la infraestreuctura de su vivienda dando de esta manera mejores condiciones en su hogar, no omite manifestar el agradecimiento a Kiva con el credito anterior pues logro su proposito de repellar su casa.  

Su mayor sueño en  la vida es estudiar un  doctorado y que sus hijos sigan en buenos caminos de Dios y que estudien para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Lilliam is 37 years old and has two school-aged children and is very thankful for her family.  Her husband works as the director of a radio station and, together, they share the household expenses.  She has worked as the director of the Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell school for 15 years.  Lilliam is a professional woman who just received her masters degree.  She is a well-loved teacher among her colleagues and students as well as her family because she is very sociable.

She is requesting her ninth loan to improve her home's infrastructure and improve living conditions.  She is grateful to Kiva for the previous loan which allowed her to plaster the walls.

Her dream is to obtain her doctor's degree and that her children follow in God's footsteps and study to be good people.

loans.use: To improve home infrastructure

loans.name: Chocolate Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento "CHOCOLATE" se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 9 personas,  sus actividades están entre venta de comida, promotora de cosméticos, modistas y transporte urbano, la mayoría de los integrantes son del barrio 8 de Septiembre de la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de la Sra. América  que se dedica a la venta de comida en su mismo domicilio y que saca a vender todos los días por la noche y que vende  a sus vecinos y conocidos ya que ella tiene mucha clientela con el dinero del crédito la Sra. América comprara ingredientes y abarrotes para la elaboración de sus platillos ,  la Sra. Eliane se dedica vender productos cosméticos  y en las noches vende pizza, ella ofrece sus productos a las amigas que tiene y vecinas de su casa, ella no tiene hijos así que el dinero que junta es para ayudar a los gastos de sus padres y juntar para poder estudiar el año que viene alguna carrera técnica en un instituto, tiene su pareja que es taxista - chofer y que la motiva a estudiar aprovechando que ellos aun no tienen hijos con el dinero del crédito comprara cosméticos que se  encuentren en promoción. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras, están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Banco de Eprendimineto “Chocolate” (“Chocolate” Communal Bank) is working its first cycle with our Institution. It is composed of 9 people, engaging in various activities such as: meals sale, cosmetics promoter, seamstress and city transportation. The majority of the members come from the 8 de Septiembre neighborhood, in the Plan 3000 area. The group was born out of the initiative of América, who engages in selling meals in her own house. She works every day in the evenings, selling her products to neighbors and acquaintances, and she has many customers. With the loan she is requesting América will buy ingredients and groceries to prepare her dishes.
Eliane engages in selling cosmetics, on top of selling pizza in the evenings. She offers her products to her female friends and neighbors. She has no children, so with the money she earns she helps her parents paying for their expenses; she will also use some next year to study for a technical career in a school. Her partner works as a cabby and as a driver, and he encourages her to study now that they have no children yet. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cosmetics on special offer. All the members are hard-working and responsible people, and they are thankful to the institution for the help provided.

loans.use: To buy ingredinets and grocery ant to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 36 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Sergio de 42 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña siempre le enseñaron a Elizabeth a trabajar en todo para alcanzar sus metas, ahora se dedica a la venta de cuyes, los cuales ella misma cría. Pero paralelamente, tiene una tienda la cual quiere hacer prosperar más. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es criar sus cuyes y lo hace con mucho amor, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar sus cuyes desde su poblado hasta la ciudad de Tarma, ya que el transporte es muy escaso y sufre buscando quien la lleve. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea meter en problemas a su banco comunal, en donde es muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más comida para sus cuyes, ya que es la actividad que mejores ingresos le está generando.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 42 year-old Sergio, and her 4 beloved children who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Since she was a little girl, Elizabeth has always been taught to work in order to achieve her goals.  Her current business is selling guinea pigs that she raises herself.   In addition, she also has a store which she would like to see prosper some more.

What Elizabeth likes most about her work is raising her guinea pigs and she does this with a lot of love.  She has been in this business for 1 year and  considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her guinea pigs from her village to the city of Tarma since transport is very scarce and it is difficult to find somebody to carry them for her.

This is Elizabeth's first loan with MFP and she is prepared to make all her repayments punctually since she doesn't want to cause problems for her community bank in which she is a very supportive member.  Elizabeth will use the 800 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more feed for her guinea pigs since this is the business that is making her the best income.

loans.use: to buy guinea pig feed

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a water selling business for the past one year, selling from home to her neighbours. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge of stiff competition from neighbours who operate the same business. Mwanamisi dreams of establishing other businesses to increase her income in the future. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to install another water tap for water distribution. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To install another water tap for water distribution.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 11 hijos (04 dependientes y 07 independientes), la señora no estudio en ningún centro educativo. 
Hace 06 años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con su primer préstamo solicitado de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de tejidos artesanales y productos veterinarios.
En la actualidad solicitará  un nuevo préstamo por la suma S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en productos veterinarios para el engorde de animales como: ivernovet plus, oxisan plus, chinfood, e-qusan, suero concentrado overmax, etc, para luego venderlos, trabaja junto con su esposo y también comprará quince unidades de lliclla, trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es crecer más en el negocio.	
Le gusta del Banco Comunal las reuniones por costumbre con las socias y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the "Virgen de Lujan" community bank which is located in Tinicachi district, in Yunguyo province, in Puno department.  She is 54 years old, married, and has 11 children (4 dependent and 7 independent).  She did not attend school.

Elena has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 years.  She invested her first loan for 300 Peruvian soles in her business selling hand-woven products and veterinary products.

Elena is currently requesting a new loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles which she will invest in veterinary products for fattening animals that she will sell such as: ivernovet plus, oxisan plus, chinfood, e-qusan, concentrated saline solution, overmax, etc.   She will also buy fifteen units of 'lliclla' (squares of woven cloth worn as shawls).

Elena works together with her husband.  Her dream is to grow her business.  She likes her community bank because of the meetings with the other members and the ease of the loans.

loans.use: to buy veterinary products and 'llicllas' (squares of woven cloth which are worn as shawls)

loans.name: Indira Magaly

texts.en:
Indira is 30 years old, married, and has two children who are currently in school. When she was younger she studied to work in the nursing field. She currently works as a nursing assistant and has been doing so for six years. She hopes to one day run her own clinic. Her husband works in the cable television industry and helps support the family. 

Indira is requesting a loan to help pay for the remodeling of her family’s home. She lives in the cold highland region of Totonicapan. This is Indira´s third loan with ASDIR, and the previous two loans have been paid back in full.

loans.use: to remodel the family's home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a single mother with three children, all of whom graduated from school and are employed. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a vegetable stall for the past four years, selling from home to her neighboring community. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of seasonality during the months of January to May when the number of customers in her food stall is low, while over the holiday season the number of customers is high. She dreams of building a permanent stall in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes. Mwanajuma decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 08 hijos (04 dependientes y 04 independientes), la señora realizo estudios hasta 3º de educación primaria. 
Con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, trabaja hace ocho años con su primer préstamo solicitado de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio compra y venta de cierres y cochinillas.
La señora solicitará  un nuevo préstamo por la suma S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, en la que utilizará para comprar cuatro sacos de cierre de todo tamaño para prendas de vestir (casacas y pantalones), lo vende en la Paz (Bolivia) junto con su esposo y hacen chacra como papa, habas y oca.
Su sueño es crecer en el negocio y mejorar.	Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones por que nos relajamos.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the "Virgen de Lujan" community bank which is located in Tinicachi district, in Yunguyo province, in Puno department.  She is 46 years old, married, and has 8 children (4 dependent and 4 independent).  She studied up to the third year of elementary school.

Justina has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 years.  She invested her first loan for 300 Peruvian soles in her business buying and selling fasteners and cochineal (a dye).  She is requesting a new loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles to buy four sacks of fasteners in all sizes for clothes (jackets and pants).  She sells her products in La Paz (Bolivia) together with her husband.  They also farm potatoes, beans and okra.  Her dream is to grow and improve her business.  What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings because they get to relax.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fasteners

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es:
Doña Rosa Matilde de  50 años de edad, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien es comerciante y la apoya con los gastos del hogar; Rosa se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, activa, responsable y dedicada a su trabajo, actualmente cuenta con un trabajo fijo ya que labora desde hace 27 años de conserje en el Hospital Jacinto Hernandez de Nueva Guineacon de donde obtiene sus ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones de pagos y los gastos basicos del hogar, ha venido obteniendo sus activos fijos mediante creditos que con tanto sacrificio y esmero ha demostrado ser buena paga realizando sus abonos en tiempo y forma. 
Solicita su sexto crèdito, para invertirlo en  compra de materiales como cemento y arena con los cuales pretende mejorar su cocina que se encuentra en mal estado, pues de esta manera mejorara las condiciones de vida, su sueño es gozar de salud y trabajo para asi ayudar a su familia ya que son bien humildes.
texts.en:
Rosa Matilde is 50 years old.  She lives with her husband, a businessman, who helps her with the home expenses.  Rosa can be described as a person who is hard working, active, responsible and dedicated to her work.  For the past 27 years she has worked as a janitor in the Jacinto Hernandez Hospital in Nueva Guineacon.  Her income earned there is used for payment obligations and the basic household expenses.  

Rosa has obtained her fixed assets through loans that through much sacrifice and effort she has proven to be reliable in making payments on time.  

She is requesting her sixth loan, which she plans to invest in materials such as cement and sand that she will use to improve her kitchen, which is run down.  In this way she will improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to enjoy health and work so that she can help her family, given their lack of economic resources.

loans.use: For making improvements in kitchen

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the four years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Dorine faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish her own permanent shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase inventory: bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sacks of rice. She decided to join Yehu because of low interest rates and affordable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Lizzeth

texts.es: Lizzeth, de 23 años, es una joven madre de familia muy a amable y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Roy de 25 años y su querida hija Tatiana de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Visitando a sus clientes en sus mismas casas Lizzeth realiza la venta de sus productos de belleza, es una vendedora muy persistente y convincente, motivo por el cual termina con las ventas de sus cosméticos rápidamente. En su pueblo es muy conocida y saben que los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejarles a sus clientas sobre los beneficios del producto para su tipo de piel. Lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cobrar, ya que no siempre sus clientes tienen con que pagarle, pero ella paciente procura que sus clientes cumplan con sus deudas. En adelante, espera poner su tienda de cosméticos, donde pueda vender mas cómoda y sin la necesidad de ir casa por casa. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, quiere hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otro préstamo, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más cosméticos, ya que por estas fiestas tiene más demanda.
texts.en:
Lizzeth is 23 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working young mother who lives in a rental house together with her husband, 25 year-old Roy, and her beloved daughter, 2 year-old Tatiana, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Lizzeth sells her beauty products by visiting her customers in their own homes.  She is a very persistent and persuasive saleswoman which means that she finishes her cosmetics sales quickly.  She is very well-known in her village and people know that the products she sells are very good quality.  What she most enjoys about her work is advising her customers on the benefits of each product for their skin type.  She has been in this business for 1 year and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be collecting payment since her customers don't always have the money to pay her.  However, she is patient and tries to make sure that her customers pay off their debts.  In the future, she hopes to set up a cosmetics store where she can make her sales more comfortably, without having to go from house to house.

This is Lizzeth's first loan with MFP and she would like to grow her business.  She will make all her repayments on time so that she can access further loans.  She knows that she has the support of her community bank.  Lizzeth will use the 500 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more cosmetics since they are in demand right now.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Juana De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Juana de Jesus de 50 años de edad, cuenta con el apoyo economica de sus hijos mayores, doña Juana tiene 22 años de trabajar como conserje del hospital Jacinto Hernandez, su compañero  trabaja como Guarda de seguridad, el cual  mensualmente la ayuda  con los gastos familiares, Juana se carateriza por ser una persona honrada, trabajadora, activa y muy responsable, proviene de familia culta y humilde, ha sido una mujer emprendedora y con deseos de superacion, lo que le ha permitido llegar a obtener sus propios bienes con sacrificios propios y asumiendos sus responsabilidades de pago con creditos obtenidos por Afodenic.  Solicita su 8vo   crèdito para construir su cocina de esta manera tener mejores condiciones en su hogar y darle mas valor a su propiedad, ademas , su sueño es que su familia gocen de mejores condiciones y salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana de Jesus is 50 years old. She receives some economic assistance from her adult children. Mrs. Juana has worked at the Jacinto Hernandez de Nueva Guineacon Hospital for 22 years as a janitor and her partner is a custodian. He helps every month with the family expenses. Juana is a very honest, hard working, active and responsible person who comes from a correct and humble family.  She has always wished to get ahead and do better and through her work and loans from Afodenic has been able to obtain their own property.

She is requesting her eighth loan to build a kitchen to improve her living conditions and increase the value of her property. Her dreams are to have good health to be able to get ahead and for her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno.  Tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 02 hijos.  Adela estudió educación superior. 
Es una socia nueva que  recientemente trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con el préstamo solicitado por la suma de S/. 1000.00 soles invertirá en su negocio, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales como: vaca, oveja, chanchos y un burro.  La señora trabaja sola en su negocio.
Su sueño es ser empresaria ganadera y poder tener ganado en cantidades para venderlos.  Lo que le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the “Virgen de Lujan” community bank, located in the district of Tinicachi, province of Yunguyo, and departament of Puno. She is 37 years old, single, and has 2 children. Adela finished high school. 
 
She is a new member who recently started working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos. With the S/. 1000.00 soles loan she has asked for, she will invest in buying and selling animals, such as: cows, sheep, pigs and a donkey. She works alone at her business. 

Her dream is is be a cattle trader and have large quantities of cattle to sell. What she likes about Manuela Ramos is the facility of the loan.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Natenin

texts.fr:
Madame Natenin C. est une femme mariée de 51 ans et mère de 9 enfants qui vit avec ses enfants et son époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni. 
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école dès son jeune âge, elle décida très tôt de mener des activités génératrices de revenus. Pendant des années elle a tenté plusieurs activités, mais sans succès. C’est ainsi qu’elle opte pour l’apprentissage de la fabrication et vente de savons traditionnels auprès de mère. Avec une expérience de 8 ans, elle maîtrise son activité. 
C’est dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, qu’elle intégra Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle  est à son deuxième prêt, le premier ayant été correctement remboursé.
Natenin compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une importante quantité de matière première  pour fabriquer du savon traditionnel.
Elle s’approvisionne en matière première dans une usine huilerie à Bougouni et la fabrication du savon se fait chez elle même à domicile. Le savon est vendu à domicile et au nouveau marché de Médine à Bamako( capitale de république du Mali). 
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA  Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Natenin C. is 51 years old, married and the mother of 9 children. She lives with her children and husband in the Torakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni. 
After leaving school at a young age, she soon decided to take up income-producing activities. For several years she tried a variety of activities but without success. So, she decided to do an apprenticeship with her mother in making and selling traditional soaps. With 8 years of experience, she is now an expert. 
With the goal of better meeting her customers needs as her business grows, she joined Soro Yiriwaso and is on her second loan. The first was properly repaid. Natenin plans to use her loan to buy a large amount of raw materials for making traditional soap. She buys the raw materials in an oil factory in Bougouni and makes the soap at her house. She sells the soap at home and in the new Médine market in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). With the loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs. With the profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make traditional soaps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Las Esperanzadas Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento "LAS ESPERANZADAS" se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro D. la Institución, compuesto por 9 personas,  sus actividades están entre venta D. ropa, comidas, albañiles, snack, fotocopiadoras y promotoras D. cosméticos, son D. la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa D. la Sra. Silvia que vive por la zona La Campana, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en las noches en su casa venD.  a sus vecinos y conocidos ya que ella tiene mucha clientela con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Silvia comprara ingredientes y abarrotes para la elaboración D. sus platillos,   su esposo es contratista - albañil, juntos aportan a la economía D. su familia ya que viven en casa D. un familiar y uno D. los deseos D. la Sra. Silvia es el comprarse un terrenito y a si poder hacer construir su casita, es una persona muy trabajadora , esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The Banco D. Emprendimiento “Las Esperanzadas” (“The Hopeful” Communal Bank) is working it first cycle with this Institution. It is composed of 9 people engaging in different activities, such as: clothes sale, food sale, masonry, snack sales, photocopying services and cosmetics promoters. They come from the Plan 3000 area. The group was born out of the initiative of Silvia. She lives in the La Campana area, and she engages in selling food in her house in the evenings. She sells to her neighbors and acquaintances and she has many customers. Silvia will use the loan amount to buy ingredients and groceries to prepare her dishes. Her husband is a masonry contractor, and they sustain the economy of their family together. They live in the house of a family member, and one of Silvia’s whishes is to buy some land where to build their house. She is a very hard-working person, and she is thankful to the institution for the help provided.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and groceries.

loans.name: Luzmery

texts.es: Luzmery, de 25 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los tejidos artesanales que Luzmery realiza, son muy novedosos y llamativos, ella los vende en el puesto que tiene en el poblado de la Unión Leticia, sus clientes prefieren comprarle por que ofrece muy buenos precios, además que es una vendedora muy carismática y persuasiva. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer, es por eso que siempre hace modelos novedosos, lleva 2  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tejer los Chullos (Prenda de vestir para la cabeza), que son lo que más se venden a los turistas. En adelante, espera poner una tienda más grande donde pueda vender sus tejidos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a pagar sin demora sus cuotas, para no perjudicarse y no meter en problemas a las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana para producir más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en: Luzmery is 25 years old. She is a straightforward and hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house with her three darling children, to whom she would like to give a better quality of life. The knitted items that Luzmery makes are very unique and artistic. She sells them at a booth that she has in the town of Unión Leticia. Her customers like to buy from her as she gives them a good price. She is a charismatic and persuasive salesperson.  What she likes best about her work is knitting the items. This is why she always makes unique items. She has been doing this business for the past two years. The most difficult item to knit is “chullos” (a clothing item worn on the head), which is what she sells most often to tourists. In the future she hopes to have a store or a larger booth where she can sell her knitted items. This is her first loan with MFP. She will pay all her loan payments on time, as she doesn’t want to cause problems for the other members of the group or prejudice the members against her. With the thousand new soles that she is requesting, she will buy wool in order to make knitted handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy wool in order to knit more items.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 51 años de edad.  Está casada y tiene 4 hijos (3 independientes), la señora no cuenta con estudio. 
Hace 06 años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio  de compra y venta de animales caseros.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará tres chanchos y dos ovejas.  Trabaja junto con su esposo.
Nos cuenta que también se dedican a la chacra, cultivando papa, habas y cebada.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y sobre todo mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la facilidad del  préstamo
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the communal bank “Virgen de Lujan” (The Virgen of Lujan), which is located in the Tinicachi district of Yunguyo Province, Puno Department.  She is 51 years old, married and has 4 children, 3 of whom live independently from her.  The señora doesn't have an education.
She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years.  Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN.  She invested it in her business, the purchase and sale of domestic livestock.
With this loan of 1000.00 PEN ($375 USD), she will purchase three pigs and two sheep.  She and her husband run her business together.
Cristina tells us that she also makes her living running a small farm.  She plants potatoes, beans and barley.
Her dream is to improve her business and especially her earnings.	
What she lives about her communal bank are the meetings and the ease of obtaining loans.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs and two sheep.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Madame Ablavi est née en 1981. Elle habite quartier Kegué. Elle est coiffeuse de profession mais elle a associé la vente des mèches et tissages. En effet elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et satisfait les clients  dans son salon de coiffure à la devanture de sa maison.  Elle compte 12 ans dans cette activité. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter 10 paquets de mèches et 10 paquets de tissage.
texts.en: Ablavi was born in 1981 and lives in the Kegué district. She is a hairdresser by trade but she combines this with the sale of hair extensions and hair weaves. She gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé and serves her customers in her hair salon in the front of her house. She has twelve years of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan to buy ten packets of hair extensions and ten packets of hair weaves.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensios

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.en:
Maria Nicolasa is 31 years old, married, and has two children. One of her children is currently studying in school. Maria works as a weaver and has four years' experience in the business. She started out operating a machine but now specializes in working by hand. She hopes to one day own her own machines and have working capital for her business. 

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase land for her family. This is Maria´s second loan through ASDIR. The previous loan has been paid back in full with no problems.

loans.use: to purchase land for family use.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Lujan” ubicado en el distrito D. Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento D. Puno, tiene 50 años D. edad.  Está casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos independientes.  La señora estudio solo hasta 3º D. educación primaria. 
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 8 años, su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio venta D. abarrotes.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, comprará productos como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, leche, aceites, conservas y otros.  En esta actividad la ayuda su hija; su esposo trabaja en el magisterio.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.	
Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana su ahorro.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the community bank "Virgen D. Lujan" [Virgin of Lujan], located in the Tinicachi district in the province of Yunguyo and department of Puno.  She is 50 years old, married, and has five grown children.  She went to school only until the third year of primary school.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used it to invest in her grocery store.  

With this loan for 3000 nuevos soles, she will purchase products like sugar, rice, pasta, milk, oils, canned goods, and more.  Her daughter helps her with her business and her husband is a teacher.

Her dream is to improve her business and have a larger income.  

She likes the community bank because it makes it easy to get a loan and she earns money on her savings.

loans.use: to purchase products like sugar, rice, pasta, milk, oils, canned food, and more.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
Grupo Mujeres Solidarias: este Grupo esta Formado por 
Angelica S. C., D. 37 años D. edad tiene 6 hijos y es casada, ella se dedica a la elavoracion D. tortillas y las venD. en su casa, desD. hace 8 años ella solicita su credito para la compra D. maiz y leña para seguir con su negocio.
Tambien esta Doña Rosa Maria C. C.,D. 36 años tiene 5 hijos y se dedica a la elavoracion D. comalales desD. hace 15 años y nos cuenta que esta muy conteneta porque es un oficio que le a gustado mucho,solicita su credito para la compra D. barro para elavoracion D. comales y asi seguir con su venta, y aumentar su ganancia.
Doña Veronica B.,quien es la loder D. este grupo ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa tipica nueva y usada, desD. hace 10 años ella estacontenta porque sus clientes la buscan en su hogar para comprar su mercaderia, ella solicita su credito para comprar ropa tipica usada ya que en esta epoca la mayoria D. gente venD.  ropa que ya esta usada ella quiere almacenar para cuando vuelva la buena epoca para vender y asi aumentar su ganancia para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
The Grupo Mujeres Solidarias [Supportive Women Group] is maD. up of three members.  

Angelica S. C. is 37 years old, married, and has six children.  She has worked making tortillas and selling them from her home for eight years.  She is asking for this loan to purchase corn and firewood to continue with her business.

Rosa Maria C. C. is 36 years old and has five children.  For 15 years, she has maD. comales [traditional clay griddles].  She is very happy because she likes her work very much.  She is asking for this loan to purchase clay to make comales so that she can continue selling them and earn more income.

Veronica B. is the leader of the group.  She has sold new and used traditional clothing for 10 years.  She is happy because her customers look for her at home to purchase her merchandise.   She is asking for this loan to purchase used traditional clothing since at this time, the majority of people are selling used clothing.  She wants to store it until it is a better time to sell and increase her income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase used traditional clothing.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly, de 23 años, es una joven muy alegre y sencilla, vive en una casa alquilada y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para poder sobresalir en la vida. El negocio de Magaly es muy concurrido sobre todo por los niños, ella tiene una tienda de videojuegos e Internet, el cual le ha dado buenos resultados, ya que le deja el dinero necesario para vivir. Son diversos los juegos que ofrece a sus clientes, por eso muchos acuden a su establecimiento,  además las maquinas que tienen se encuentran en buen estado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver la alegría que sienten los niños al jugar, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es controlar en el pago, aún así se siente muy satisfecha con su trabajo y espera que el futuro pueda incrementar el número de maquinas de videojuego que tiene actualmente. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, desea ser muy puntual en sus pagos, motivo por el cual los está programando desde ahora, para no fallar, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, mandará  arreglar sus maquinas, ya que por el uso se han ido malogrando.
texts.en:
Magaly is 23 years old and is a happy and simple young woman.  She lives in a rented house and the thing she wants most is to work hard to be able to succeed in life.  

Magaly's business is very popular, mostly with children.  She has a video game and Internet cafe.  This has given her good results since it gives her the income necessary to live.  She offers many different games to her customers, so many people come to her store.  Additionally, the machines that she has are in good condition.  The thing she likes best about her work is to see the happiness that the children feel as they are playing.  

She has had this business for two years.  The most difficult part of her business is to control the payments.  She feels very satisfied with her work and hopes to be able to increase the number of video game machines she has in the future.  

This is her first loan with MFP and she wants to be very punctual in her payments, so she is scheduling them so that she doesn't fail.  She is a happy and responsible member of her community bank.  With the 500 nuevos soles she is asking for, she will fix her machines that are currently broken.

loans.use: to fix the video game machines at her internet cafe.

loans.name: Minerva Mirabal 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maura is one of the members of 'Minerva Mirabal group' (named after one of the legendary Mirabal sisters who resisted and were killed by the dictator Trujillo). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti, generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children.

Maura is excited to be taking out her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling bacon and sausage by purchasing pork and beef, to prepare salted meat and pork sausage. She will use the profits to cover her home expenses. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy pork and beef to prepare and sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Lujan” ubicado en el distrito D. Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento D. Puno, tiene 49 años D. edad.  Está casada y tiene 5 hijos (2 independientes), la señora estudio hasta 2º D. educación primaria. 
Dominga trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 05 años, su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio venta D. tejidos artesanales (aguayos).
Con éste crédito D. S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará 60 ovillos D. lana para la fabricación D. aguayos y 20 kilos D. cochinilla para venderlos en Bolivia.  Dominga trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es seguir creciendo en el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que más le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la unión y responsabilidad D. las socias, además lo que gana su ahorro.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the community bank "Virgen D. Lujan" [Virgin of Lujan], located in the Tinicachi district, province of Yunguyo and department of Puno.  She is 49 years old, married, and has five children (two are independent).  She went to school until the second year of primary school.

Dominga has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she invested it in her business selling hand-woven fabrics (aguayos).  

With this loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will purchase 60 balls of wool to make aguayos and 20 kilos of yarn dyed red with cochinilla insects that she will sell in Bolivia.  Dominga works together with her husband.

Her dream is to continue growing her business and increase her income.

The thing she likes best about the community bank is the unity and responsibility of the members, and the money that her savings earns.

loans.use: to purchase 60 balls of wool to make traditional multicolored cloth and 20 kilos of red-dyed yarn.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 68 años de edad.  Está casada y tiene 6 hijos (3 independientes), la señora estudio educación primaria incompleto. 
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y chanchos.
En la actualidad requerida de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de 3 chanchos y ovejas.  Pascuala trabaja junto con su esposo.  Paralelamente se dedican a la chacra, cosechan papa, habas, cebada, etc.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.	
Lo que le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad en que otorgan los préstamos.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Luján" (Our Lady of Luján) located in the district of Tinicachi, province of Yunguyo and department of Puno. She is 68 years old, married and the mother of six children (three are independent). She has an incomplete elementary school education.

She has been working with the microfinance institution Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan amounted to 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business. She sells groceries and pigs. Currently she applies for a new loan of 1000 nuevos soles. She will use the money to buy three pigs and sheep. Pascuala works with her husband. They are also working at their farm, harvesting potatoes, beans, barley, etc.

Her dream is to improve her business and her quality of life. What she likes about Manuela Ramos is the easiness of their loan granting procedure.

loans.use: to buy 3 pigs and sheep

loans.name: Denic Maria

texts.es:
Desnic de 23 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien asume los compromisos de pagos en conjunta con ella, han pagado los crèditos obtenidos; ambos son docente y dos jovenes luchadores que les gusta el progreso, ella  trabaja como docente de educaciòn primaria  en la Escuela Francisco Aaron Joce desde hace 7 años impartiendo el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesino de la colonia Naciones,  es  habitante de la  zona  Naciones Unida.  
Solicicita su 4to crèdito para comprar materiales de construcciòn  para construir un porche en su vivienda, a la vez agradece a Kiva por el financiamiento anterior esto le permitio mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda al repellar las paredes.  

Esta joven tiene muchos sueños por cumplir uno de ellos es ver su casa con todas las mejoras necesarias que le brinde las condiones comodamente a su familia y otro sueño principal es el de llegar a tener sus hijos y poder darles los mejor, mucho amor y dedicacion.
texts.en:
Desnic is 23 years old and lives with her husband.  They share responsibility for making their loan repayments.  They have both repaid previous loans.

Desnic and her husband are teachers.  They are both determined young people who like to make progress in life.  Desnic is a teacher at Francisco Aaron Joce Elementary School.  She has been teaching children from the rural Naciones district for 7 years.  She lives in Naciones Unidas district.

Desnic is requesting her fourth loan to buy construction supplies so that she can build a porch on her home.  At the same time, she is grateful to Kiva for her previous loan which enabled her to improve her home by plastering the walls.

This young lady has many dreams to fulfil.  One of them is to see her house with all the improvements it needs to provide her family with comfortable living conditions.  Another one of her biggest dreams is to have children and be able to provide them with the best, a lot of love and devotion.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 29 years old and married. He has three children, and two are currently studying in school. Martin works as a bricklayer and has been doing so for 10 years. He started out as a bricklayer’s assistant and worked his way up to the position he has now. He hopes to one day be a construction foreman. His wife works as a weaver and helps support the family. 

Martin is requesting a loan to help pay for the remodeling of his family home. This is his second loan with ASDIR. The previous loan was repaid in full with no problems.

loans.use: to remodel and expand the family home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, rice, beans, oil, vegetables, bags, plates, etc.

loans.name: Nelvis Tomas

texts.es:
El joven  Nelvis Tomas  de 26 años de edad trabaja como docente de primaria  desde hace 6 años, su esposa tambien se desempeña como docente de primaria ambos son docente graduados y devengan un salario mensual que les permite vivir comodamente, Nelvis se caracteriza por ser una persona con un alto espiritu de superacion, responsable y honesto, de buenas costumbres y con excelentes relaciones sociales es bien querido por sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo.  

Solicita nuevamente el apoyo de Kiva en su 4to crèdito para comprar materiales de construcciòn  e ir comprando poco a poco ya que de un solo se le hace dificil por sus ingresos que son limitados, pretende comprar cierta parte de materiales para luego realizarle mejoras a su humilde vivienda que aun le falta, a la vez agradece a Kiva por el financiemiento anterior el cual fue beneficiado, pues logro repellar las paredes de su casa.   

Su sueño es culminar sus estudios universitarios y tener estabilidad laboral y tambien que su familia permanezca siempre unida.
texts.en:
Nelvis Tomas Young is a young man of 26 years of age, has worked as primary school teacher for six years and his wife also serves as school teacher. They both have an education degree and earn a monthly salary that allows them to live comfortably. Nelvis is characterized as a person with a high spirit of excellence, responsible and honest, with good manners and good social relationships, well liked and respected by his neighbors and coworkers.
He requested the support of Kiva with this 4th loan to buy construction material. He is making his purchases little by little, considering his limited income. His plan is to make improvements to his humble housing and build what is still missing. He is grateful to Kiva for the previous loans he received and that allowed him to plaster the walls of his house.
His dream is to go to graduate school, have job security and keep his family always together.

loans.use: to purchase construction material

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Madame Kossiwa a un enfant et est âgée de 45 ans. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait le commerce des  condiments et des œufs. En réalité, elle a commencé son activité en 2001 et s’approvisionne à Koumassi au Ghana.  Elle revient vendre au marché local de Hedzranawoé à Lomé la capitale du Togo. Elle espère accroître son commerce et sollicite au près de wages un crédit.
texts.en: Kossiwa has one child and is 45 years old. In order to be able to contribute to the household, she buys and sells condiments and eggs. She began her business in 2001 and gets her supplies in Koumassi in Ghana. She comes back to sell her products at the local market in Hedzranawoé in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is hoping to expand her business and is requesting a loan from Wages.

loans.use: to purchase condiments and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy zinc to change the roof of her parents' house.

loans.name: Selifatou

texts.fr: Madame Selifatou est née en 1964 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales qu’elle achète à Anié. Elle a commencé en 1989 et revend les céréales au marché de Hedzranawoé. De plus, elle avait eu un crédit qu’elle a déjà soldé. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter  2 sacs de riz, 3 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs d’haricot, 3 sacs de mil, 2 sacs de soja et 2 sacs de petit piment.
texts.en: Selifatou was born in 1964 in Lomé. She is married and mother to three children. She retails cereals which she buys in Anié. She began doing this in 1989 and resells the cereals at the market in Hedzranawoé. She has had a loan which she has already repaid and is now requesting a loan to buy two bags of rice, three bags of corn, two bags of beans, three bags of millet, two bags of soya and two bags of small peppers.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel hostel water system.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Nidia, de 34 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Carlos de 42 años y sus 2 queridas hijas Carla de 11 y Mikaela de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La tienda de Nilda es la primera en abrirse en su pueblo, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su tienda no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
34 year-old Nidia is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 42 year-old Carlos, and her 2 beloved daughters: 11 year-old Carla and 3 year-old Mikaela, who are the driving force behind all her efforts.

Nidia's store is the first to open in her village.  She opens her doors at 6.00am, ready to receive her early-morning customers who are aware of the variety of merchandise that she has in her store and do not hesitate to buy from her.  They can be sure that they will find what they need.  What Nidia most enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers and finding out what is happening in her village.  She has been in this business for 2 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be staying in her store all day without being able to go out.  Over time, Nidia would like to grow her business and provide her customers with a better service.

This is Nidia's first loan with MFP and she hopes to be able able to make her repayments on time since she doesn't want to cause problems for the other members of her community bank.  Nidia is a very respected member because she brings order to the group.  She will use the 500 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more products to better stock her store.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store

loans.name: Pasuc Group

texts.es: Doña Pascuala confesora, es la representante D. este grupo, es casada, tiene 51 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad  D. estudiar, tiene 8 hijos 1 D. los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la crianza D. animales, cuenta con 15 años D. experiencia, empezó con entusiasmo y esmero para tener una pequeña granja D. pollos, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la confección D. prendas, solicita un prestamos para comprar mas gallinas para la granja que tiene, deciD. organizar un grupo para solicitar un prestamo e incrementar su capital D. trabajo, los integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza D. animales y tambien la confección D. prendas.
texts.en: Pascuala Confesora is the representative of this group.  She is 51 years old, married, and didn't have the opportunity to go to school.  She has 8 children, 1 of whom is studying.  Pascuala's business is raising animals and she has 15 years experience in this business.  She started out with enthusiasm and great care, and set up her own small chicken farm.  She has the support of her husband who makes clothes.  Pascuala is requesting this loan to buy more hens for her farm.  She decided to form a group to request a loan and increase her working capital.  The other members of the group raise animals and make clothes.

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Brenda Aracely

texts.es: Brenda Aracely C.: es de 25 años tiene un hijo es casada, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica y a la elavoracion de prendas de vestir para Dama Y Caballero, ella lleva 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, nos cuenta que le ha hido bien en su nogocio porque le a generado buena ganancia ella solicita este credito para la compra de 3 cortes tipicos,y compra de telas para elavorar prendas de vestir, ella espera que con este credito pueda aumentar mas sus ganancias y asi poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Brenda Aracely C., is 25 years old and married with one child. Her work is selling traditional garments and making clothing for men and women. She has worked in this area for 8 years, and she reports that her business has gone well for her, because it has generated a good income. She is requesting this loan to buy 3 pieces of traditional woven cloth and to buy fabrics to make clothing. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to further increase her earnings and thus help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing and to buy 3 traditional woven cloth pieces

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand a dwelling

loans.name: Blanca Seni

texts.es:
Blanca Seni  Y. Y. tiene 40 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se reúnen en la ciudadela 24 de Mayto está ventanilla se dedica a actividades comerciales como la vetan de perfumes, ropa, bisutería, etc.

Blanca se dedica a la comercialización de venta de cometidos como Avon por pedidos en revistas, las compras las realiza por medio de una llamada telefónica y las vente por medio de revista puerta a puerta.

Solicita el crédito para adquirir los productos por medio de catalogo y tener los productos en una tienda,  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y los precios altos. Su sueño es comprar un vehiculo y tener su negocio propio.

Le gusta ver la televisión y salir a vender sus productos
texts.en:
Blanca Seni Y. Y. is 40 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. She has four children.

The members of the community bank ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA [Tomorrow's Success] are located in the Ventanas canton.  They meet in the May 24 neighborhood.  They all work selling products like perfumes, clothing, jewelery, etc.  

Blanca works selling cosmetics like Avon by catalog.  She makes the purchases by phone, and sells the products door to door by catalog.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase the products from the catalog and have them in a store.  The support of this loan will help her to meet her need financially.  She encounters obstacles like competition and high prices.  Her dream is to purchase a vehicle and have her own store.

She likes to watch television and go out to sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products by catalog.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad.  Ella es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos.  La señora realizó estudios de educación primaria. 
Sonia trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la elaboración de productos de panadería.
Este préstamo de S/.  2300.00 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de 30 quintales de harina para la producción del pan.  Nos cuenta que cada día elabora dos quintales de harina.  Ella recibe la ayuda de su esposo, con quien también hace chacra como papa, habas y maíz.
Su sueño es mejorar en el negocio para tener buenos ingresos económicos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Luján" (Our Lady of Luján) located in the district of Tinicachi, province of Yunguyo and department of Puno. She is 34 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and is the mother of five children. She has completed elementary school education.

She has been working with the microfinance institution Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan amounted to 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business. She is a baker. Currently she applies for a new loan of 2,300 nuevos soles which she will use to buy 30 quintals (about 1,350 kilograms or 3,000 pounds) of flour for bread-making. Every day she uses up 2 quintals of flour (about 90 kilograms or 200 pounds) in her bakery. Her husband helps her. They work also at their farm, harvesting potatoes, beans and corn.

Her dream is to improve her business and earn a good income. What she likes about her communal bank are the earnings from her savings.

loans.use: to buy flour for bread-making

loans.name: Verónica Gabriela

texts.es:
Verónica Gabriela A. E. tiene 32 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se reúnen en la ciudadela 24 de Mayto está ventanilla se dedica a actividades comerciales como la vetan de perfumes, ropa, bisutería, etc.

Verónica se dedica a la comercialización de venta de ropa en su tienda, las compras las realiza en la Ciudad de guayaquil comprar al por mayor y las vende en su negocio al por menor.

Solicita el crédito para adquirir mercadería para tener los productos en una tienda,  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y los precios altos. Su sueño es tener un negocio con mayores productos y ampliar el negocio.

Le gusta leer la Biblia.
texts.en:
Veronica is 32 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ventanas canton, De los Rios province.

The members of the “Éxito de Mañana” (Tomorrow's Success) communal bank all reside in Ventanas canton.  They meet in the “24 de Mayo” (24th of May) tenement block.  The bank supports their commercial activities, including sales of perfumes, clothing, costume jewelry, etc.

Veronica sells clothing in her store.  She buys merchandise in the city of Guayaquil at wholesale and sells it at retail.  She is requesting a loan to acquire merchandise and have more products in her store.  The loan will help her purchase the necessities and confront challenges such as competition and high prices.  Her dream is to have a business with more products and to expand her business.

She likes to read the Bible.

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE TO HAVE PRODUCTS IN HER STORE

loans.name: Bella Alegria

texts.es:
Bella Alegria Z. P. tiene 37 años, Es soltera vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se reúnen en la ciudadela 24 de Mayto está ventanilla se dedica a actividades comerciales como la vetan de perfumes, ropa, bisutería, etc.

Bella se dedica a la comercialización de venta de cometidos como Yambal por pedidos en revistas, las compras las realiza por medio de una llamada telefónica y las vente por medio de revista puerta a puerta.
